129540.name: Battleforce Bravo: Aircraft
rpgitemversion: Wings Over America - Air Corps U.S. Army
129540.description:
User Summary:

A collection of WWII aircraft descriptions and game stats for use with the Battleforce Bravo rpg.

129541.name: Treads & Tracks
129541.description:
User Summary:

A collection of descriptions and game stats of WWII tanks and other combat ground vehicles for the Battleforce Bravo rpg.

129542.name: Fiery Crossroad
129542.description:
From the Introduction:

Beyond the doors lies a peculiar kind of room. The corridor continues to cross it, after a fashion, along it's axis intersected by another similar walkway at its center. Instead of walls you find steep drops on either side, with only a few solid columns every few feet. Waves of oppressive heat waft of the molten rock blubbering a few feet below the gangway and its glow plunges the room into a hellish light.

Narrow guard platforms line the long walls of the room separated from the central walkway by several feet of glowing molten rock, open door frames leading into much more spacious guardrooms behind them. Quite obviously this room is some kind of important junction in this dungeon, and it was built to make sure no one crossing it would go unnoticed.

129543.name: Basketball
129543.description:
Objective: score most hits
Table version of basketball. Players direct the metal ball on the play field in such way to score the goal (2 points). Players figures are placed on small springs.
If active player scores ball possession changes; if basketball hoop is missed player proceeds where ball ended. If ball ends outside other player proceeds. Game ends after aggreed time or result.

129544.description:
Promotional card included with orders from Plaid Hat Games for a limited time period.

Bodgan is a Champion of the Mercenaries. His special ability reads:
Repelling Stench
After attacking with Bodgan, you may move each enemy Unit that is adjacent to Bodgan up to 1 space.
129544.name: Summoner Wars: Bodgan

129545.name: Flashpak
129545.description:
User summary

Flashpak contains a Cyberpunk V3.0 GM screen and a 32 page quick-start booklet titled Streetfighter.

129547.name: Funky Party Games: Blind Paint
129547.description:
A party game that involves blindfolded drawing and guessing.

It is played in two teams. One player has to wear a blindfold so that he/she can't see what he/she is drawing. The other team members have to guess the words/phrases that are being drawn. There are easy tasks (a simple word, such as "house") and difficult ones (sometimes whole proverbs like "People who live in glass houses shouldn't throw stones."). Difficult tasks are worth more points than the easy ones. The team with the most points wins the game.

Components:
- 1 pencil
- 1 sand timer
- 1 notepad
- 1 blindfold
- 50 cards
- instructions

129548.name: Trifecta Poker
129548.description:
Trifecta Poker is based on a Trifecta of winning Horse Cards as Win, Place, and Show.

A blend of Horse Racing, Classic Poker games and all original Artwork.

This set of Race Horse Playing cards is a real game changer. For instance every card is a Face Card and there are no Kings or Queens, Jacks nor Aces. The Royalty here or the Ace of the Race is represented by what horse is the Winner of the Race. These cards wear Silks not Suits.

This is the only game that tells you the Winners before you Start. The only question is who holds the Winning hand. The objective of the Play is to determine if You hold a Winning hand and have a chance to take home the Cash. The Rules are Simple but you can't Win if you don't Try and it's obviously better if you Trifecta!

The rules are simple in the basic form of play however, all sorts of other cards games can be played with this new game.
Here are the rules:

The Rules
Trifecta Poker Hand Rankings

Trifecta Poker can be played using almost any variation of common Poker Play rules. The Key to Trifecta Poker is that the winning hand is based on a Trifecta of winning Horse Cards. 

Dealer shuffles the 52 Cards and draws 3 different Horse Cards in a vertical display outward from the POT known as the Trifecta Flop. After each play the cards are shuffled and a new Trifecta Flop is drawn. The First Horse drawn is the Winning Horse, the 2nd is the Place and the 3rd is the Show - aka WPS. or a Superfecta game a 4th Horse is drawn. Duplicate Horse cards if they appear in the Flop are returned to the deck. Dealer then re-shuffles the remaining deck and deals 5 cards to each player. Players may now hold pat their original cards or draw from one to four new cards from the deck. The Player with the highest combinations of Trifecta, Quinella, or WPS card combinations wins. A Trifecta is all three winning horses, a Quinella is the Win and Place horses, and the WPS are any horses in the money. WPS combinations are ranked by the highest number of Horse cards in the money without a Trifecta or Quinella.

All Trifecta Poker hand rankings can be improved by also holding typical Poker combinations as shown below:

For instance no. 1 : A Trifecta with a pair of any horses beats a Trifecta with no pair.
For instance no. 2: A Win horse with three of a kind beats a Win horse with a pair.
If NO players hold WPS Cards typical Poker Hand rankings are won as follows:
Four of a Kind - Four of the same Horse cards.
Full House- Three of a kind and a pair. The player with the higher value three of a kind, wins in the event of a tie. If both players have the same three of a kind then the player with the highest pair wins.
Straight -Five cards of any horses in ascending order with the higher straight wins the tie.
Three of a Kind- Simply three cards of the same horse.
Two Pairs of Horses - The player holding the highest pair takes the pot in the event that more than one player is holding two pairs. If two players are both holding the same two pair then the player with the highest fifth horse (i.e. the kicker) takes the pot.
One Pair of Horses-Two cards of the same horse.
HIGH Horse -Highest card takes all in the event there is a complete absence of the above hands.

129549.name: Ports of Call: The Frontier Zone
129549.description:
from the introduction

One of the joys of Bulldogs! is the constant discovery of new places. Let’s face it – it's boring to spend every adventure flying back and forth between the same two points. Bulldogs! is about going to strange new places, meeting new people, turning a profit any way possible, and hoping you don’t get shot at in the process.

Ports of Call is a collection of new starports and planets from the Frontier Zone. Each location is sketched in, with the details that make it special – the general environment, port amenities, the local laws, what the native residents are like, what kind of jobs you’re likely to find, and what kinds of trouble you might get into. If a new alien species makes the planet their home, Ports of Call presents them as a new playable species.

This supplement contains basically everything a Class D Freight crewman needs when the airlock opens – all summed up in a few pages. Each entry has just enough information for a quick pick-up game setting, or for the GM to drop into an ongoing game however she chooses. Additionally, each entry will have a handful of story hooks and non-player characters to inspire single sessions or campaigns.

Ready? Check your blasters and vibro-knives. The airlock is opening. The next port of call awaits!

129550.name: Shadows of Esteren Game Master Screen
129550.description:
user summary

Game Master Screen

this is a three panel screen, each panel is 7.63 inches high by 12 inches wide

user comment

The screen was a specific reward for a certain level of kick-starter backer and while it has a ton of information and references to specific book pages in the English version

there is no visible trademark, item number or blurb.

129551.name: Super Soccer
129551.description:
Soccer simulation. The field is a grid of 6 x 5 boxes. Each player receives a pack of action cards. Either coach place the 11 pawn in the pitch.

The mechanism is simple: the player with possession of the ball takes three cards attack action and puts them into three boxes of your choice on the board, empty or occupied by pawns or their opponents. Two of the three cards played, however, are "cards bluff" and only serve to pull the wool over the eyes of the defender, who has two cards only line of defense to counter the effect of the cards of attack and must therefore try to guess where the attacker has the real paper and where the bluff. Place the cards, move the pieces closer to where they were put in the boxes of the tiles, the tiles are discovered and resolved effects. If the defender did not guess where the attacker has put the card real action, this explains its effects immediately. If you have guessed, it resolves the conflict according to a mechanism completely devoid of throwing dice (sic): the proceeds to count a series of penalties against both the defender the attacker (for example, for each opposing checker that is located on the trajectory of a passage the attacker receives a penalty). If you are under penalty wins the contrast. In case of a tie the defender wins. If the attacker loses the ball as time counter moves forward one minute.
The action cards allow it to attack steps, jumps, throws, crosses, headers and volleys.

The action cards allow defensive tackle and advances (ground ball or head).

Resolved shots: the attacker has a certain number of points distributed on a shot that has a football goal (drawn on a separate sheet) divided into six sections. The goalkeeper has 14 points that can be distributed parade of no more than five of the six sections. The choice is made for both in secret. If at least one section there are several points that shot points parade's goal. Otherwise, parade. In case of a tie, corner.

Who wins at the end of the two times (the duration of which may be agreed between the players) have scored more goals.

129552.name: Zed Zero
129552.description:
back cover blurb

What's your zombie apocalypse plan?

The modern world is filled with horror, action, excitement and drama, more than we ever wanted, and yet something's missing through all of it... you still find yourself asking, "Where are all the ZOMBIES?".

Zed Zero is a role-playing game designed to answer that question, and bring to life the Zombie Apocalypse like never before. Giving you the tools to tell the story of the Apocalypse, its survivors and the fate of mankind.

Your character can be anyone, from anywhere with any plan or no plan at all. They can be someone or no-one. The choice is yours because its your world.

In Zed Zero, the rules don't dictate your actions, your actions dictate the rules. We give you limitless control over your character and the actions within our fast and flexible rule system.

129553.name: The Hunter's Cabin
129553.description:
Back cover Blurb:

The Hunter's Cabin is a stand alone game, designed to give you a sneak peak at the world and system of the Zed Zero RPG. Inside you'll find everything you and your friends need (except for the dice) to play a game: the pertinent rules, pregenerated characters, and challenging game play.

Expand the gameplay with the Zed Zero core rules. At the end of this module is the chance to rescue the characters and sweep them away to the safety of the city, and open up a new apocalyptic world of options for them.

129554.name: Pim Pam Pet cardgame
129554.description:
Players draw a category card and read the topic. Then they draw the letter-card instead of turning the wheel like in original Pim-Pam-Pet. Everyone is trying as quickly as possible to find a word that matches the subject and with that specific letter in start, in end or in middle of the word etc.

A good answer is rewarded by a chip in the color of the question.
Who at the end of the game has scored the most points is the winner.

129555.name: Terra Nova / Tartarus flip book
129555.description:
user summary

GenCon 2012 exclusive

Has the complete Terra Nova adventure from one end, flip it over for the entire TarTarus Adventure from the other.

Includes "Stowaway", a 15 minute Ashen Stars Demo written by Kevin Kulp and Pregenerated Characters.

129556.description: Each round in Tapple, one player draws a topic card, then starts the timer. In the next ten seconds, that player must give a single word answer that fits within the topic, press down the letter key in a special electronic device that corresponds to the first letter of that word, and restart the timer. The next player must then think of a word for the topic that starts with a different letter, press down that starting letter, and restart the timer. If a player runs out of time, she's out for the round. If only one player remains in a round, she collects the topic card. If players manage to press down all of the letters before knocking all but one player out of a round, the players reset the device, draw a new topic card, then start the timer again, this time having to give two answers for the topic – each starting with a different letter – within the allotted time. Whoever collects the most topic cards wins!
129556.name: Tapple
boardgamepodcastepisode: BW034 – Dominion
The Party Gamecast Reviews - Match Games (2 of 5) - Tapple

129557.name: Zombie HQ
129557.description:
Stop the zombie infestation!

"The city seems strange these days. All the bars shut down, nowhere to get a drink and relax...

And these damn zombies everywhere you turn! Already killed so many of 'em but they just keep on coming. Only good zombie is a dead zombie. Good thing there's plenty of guns around.

Still, wish there was some place to take it easy for a while. Some place up high where a fella could catch a break from bashing zombie skulls. You know, a "Zombie HQ" of sorts..."

The ZOMBIE INFESTATION in the city is seriously getting in the way of your down time. Take back your city and reclaim what is yours!

Scour the streets for salvage to get BIGGER AND BADDER GUNS, explosives, and other zombie-killing weapons.

RESCUE SURVIVORS from the zombie horde and airlift them to safety for BONUS REWARDS.

Then catch a breath in your ZOMBIE HQ. Deck out your ultimate man-cave with pool tables, hot tubs, TVs, turntables, plants and more!

Source: The Publisher Website.

129558.name: 2-Bit Bub
129558.description:
ParaNorman's 2-Bit Bub is an adorably odd action-puzzler starring mobile gaming's weirdest new hero. Bub is a ghost-dog in two bits, and it's up to you to slingshot his ectoplasmically conjoined body through 30 levels of stunning visuals pulled straight from the movie!

Source: The Game Website.

129559.name: Wasgij Spin & Shout
129559.description:
Players place the picture board at the middle of the table.
In his turn player spins the spinner and if the arrow stops and points the letter all players look at the picture to search for something that starts with that letter.
First to points something and shouts it scores a point.

The ﬁrst player to reach the pre-agreed points wins the game!

129560.name: Little Kingdom Royal Picnic Game
129560.description:
Magical electronic board game where players have to help Ben and Holly using Holly’s magic and transform the animals back into their fairy and elf characters. Roll the dice and race around the board collecting the correct animal cards, if you land on a picnic basket space you can attempt one of Holly’s spells – the basket will either playa sound to transform the animals back or make a ‘bang’ which means the spell didn’t work.

If all the animlas are transforms the player with the most animals transformed is the winner.

129561.name: Mighty Fin!
129561.description:
ENJOY YOUR STAY…
Fin needs a vacation. He's signed up for Shady Sal's suspiciously cheap — and possibly deadly — Round the World Tour. Hey, money's tight when you're a working fish.

Mighty Fin is an addictive arcade game that's easy to pick up, hard to master and impossible to put down.

Source: The Developer Website.

129562.name: Peppa Pig Fairground Game
129562.description:
Peppa Pig Fairground Ride Game is fun and exciting 3D game of musical air-swings – but with a fun and exciting twist for young children.

The game begins when each player chooses their Peppa Pig character to play with, and places it on a seat on the fairground ride. The youngest player begins by pressing down on the red button top and everyone watches the air swings spin round and around and listening to the fun musical tune that will be playing. The aim of the game is to be the last player sat on the air swings – but if you Peppa Pig figurine lands next to a red ‘Hop Off’ space, then they must hop off the ride and try to guess where the empty seat will land next. Did you guess it right? If not, don’t worry, you have until the winner is left on the swings to hop back on the ride.

129563.name: The Little Game of Food
129563.description:
This food-themed trivia/party game can be played in two teams or with at least two players.
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible, by answering questions about food and performing tasks from the activity cards. Each card is worth 1 point. The first player to reach the finish space on the board wins the game.

Activity cards come in two types: "Picture Memo" and "Mashed Letters". "Picture Memo" means the active player has to memorize the picture on the card. After 30 seconds, the player on the left makes up a question about the picture, which the active player has to answer. In the "Mashed Letters" activity, there are three words on the card, with their letters jumbled. The active player has to guess the words while the timer is running.

129564.name: Peppa Pig Jumping Pigs
129564.description: Players try and jump the Peppa Pig playing counters into the muddy puddle on the table in the middle of the game box and the first player to do this is the winner of the round. You can play as many rounds as you like, because after all, Peppa loves nothing more than jumping in the biggest and muddiest puddle she can find!

129565.name: Peppa Pig: Muddy Puddles Game
129565.description:
Peppa Pig loves playing in the rain and jumping in muddy puddles is one of her favourite games. Can you help Peppa jump in lots of muddy puddles on her way to school? Peppa Pig’s Muddy Puddle Game is designed for young children to have fun and enjoy a basic board game layout. Players use the Peppa playing figures to jump their way around the board and try to be the first in class - and win the game. The centre spinner adds fun and excitement - you’ll want to be the muddiest in class to win the game.

The game is for 2 to 4 players. There are some words on the game board – Start, Fiinsh and jump! -, but players do not have to be able to read to play. The game uses different coloured ‘squares’ to move around the board, and the spinner uses images to indicate where the players move to next, so this game can be enjoyed by your young Peppa Pig fan.

129566.name: The Little Game of Good Manners
129566.description:
This trivia/party game can be played in two teams or with at least two players. The topic is "good manners".

The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible, by answering questions about good manners and performing tasks from the activity cards. Each card is worth 1 point. The game is over when the first player reaches the goal box. The player who has won the most cards/points is the winner.

Activity cards come in two types: "Picture Memo" and "Confusing Letters". "Picture Memo" means the active player has to memorize the picture on the card. After 30 seconds, the player on the left makes up a question about the picture, which the active player has to answer. In the "Confusing Letters" activity, there are three words on the card, with their letters jumbled. The active player has to guess the words while the timer is running.

129567.name: Peppa Pig Tumble & Spin
129567.description:
Shuffle the cards and place them face-down, in a circle around the Peppa Pig figurine. The youngest player begins by spinning Peppa as hard as he can. Wait until Peppa comes to a full stop. If she stops by your marker, listen carefully to what Peppa says (If Peppa stops in between two markers, she is talking to the person whose marker she has just passed.):

1. Peppa says “One!” - Turn over one of the cards. Call out the friend’s name. Is it your friend? then you get to keep the card. Is it one of the other player’s friend? Then show the card to the other players and put it back in the circle.
2. “Two!” You’re lucky! You may now look at two cards. Call out the friend’s name each time you turn over one of the cards. Is your friend on either of the cards? Then you get to keep that card. If it’s one of the other player’s friend, then show the card to the other players and put it back in the circle.
3. “Close your eyes!” Oh no! Now you have to give back one of your cards. Close your eyes while the other players hide it among the cards that are on the table. They must not tell you where they have put it!

The winner is the player who can collect all their friend picture cards first.

129568.name: The Constructed
rpgseries: Monster of the Week Hunter Playbook
129568.description:
From Introduction:

I am not alive, yet I live.
My body is not of flesh, yet I move.
I have no heart, yet I feel.
I have no brain, yet I think and have purpose...
...And the will to fulfill that purpose.

A Monster of the Week hunter playbook.

129569.name: The Mad Scientist
rpgseries: Monster of the Week Hunter Playbook
129569.description:
From Introduction:

Why, yes, I do consider myself to be an expert on the subject of monsters... having created a few of my own. Oh no, don't worry. I gave up such things and have dedicated my life to eradicating monsters now.
Hmm... yes... eradicating them... most certainly...

A Monster of the Week hunter playbook.

129570.name: Quirinalopoli. Corsa alla Presidenza
129570.description:
“Quirinalopoli. Rush for the Presidency” is a political version of a roll-and-move gamey styled like the Game of Goose enclosed to “Il Borghese” magazine in the summer 1997: it consisted of a board and the miniatures of eight Italian politicians of the day to be used as playing pieces. Players roll the dice and move their figures and respond to spaces on the board.


“Quirinalopoli” è un Gioco dell’Oca a tema politico allegato alla rivista “Il Borghese” nell’estate 1997: oltre alla plancia di gioco sono state realizzate anche le miniature di otto “protagonisti della Seconda Repubblica” da utilizzarsi come pedine.

129571.name: Molecularama
129571.description:
Molecularama is a pattern-matching, set-collecting chemistry-themed card game similar to Gin Rummy and Ticket to Ride. Collect and swap element cards to build up molecules and score points.

The game comes with 24 different molecules and 75 element cards. Each player is trying to collect the correct elements to build them. Build six molecules to win the game but beware of attempting to build too many molecules, any unfinished molecules by the end of the game will penalise your score!

There are two modes of play to choose from; play with a secret selection of molecules in your hand where everyone is trying to guess what you're building, or play with a selection of molecule cards open on the table where two people could be racing to build the same thing.

Each molecule card comes with a witty joke or and interesting tid-bit. Remember, if you're not part of the solution, you're part of the precipitate.

129572.name: Tr3cento. Una giornata nella Bolzano del 1300
129572.description:
“Tr3cento. A day in Bolzano, 1300 A.D.” is a historically-themed didactic game made on the occasion of a gothic painters exhibition that took place in the Italian town of Bolzano in the year 2000.

The aim of the game is experiencing everyday’s life in the XIV century’s Bolzano.

Before starting, every player draws a card showing a different character and, by rolling a die and answering questions (each character has an own set), needs to make a whole round on the map in order to win the game.


“Tr3cento. Una giornata nella Bolzano del 1300” è un gioco didattico a tema storico realizzato per un’esposizione di pittori gotici allestita a Bolzano nel 2000.

Scopo del gioco è sperimentare la vita quotidiana nella Bolzano del Trecento.

All’inizio ogni giocatore pesca un personaggio da un mazzo di carte e - ora lanciando un dado, ora rispondendo a diverse domande (cambiano da personaggio a personaggio) - deve completare un giro della mappa per vincere.

129575.name: Transformers: Fall of Cybertron
129575.description:
Transformers: Fall of Cybertron transports you to the final days of the planet Cybertron where you will experience the darkest hours of the apocalyptic war between the Autobots and Decepticons. Embark on an adrenaline0fueled journey through a wide range of missions and massive environments designed around each character's unique abilities. The combat is intense as you dynamically transform between robot and vehicle form to change the battle as you choose.

Source: The Game Website.

129576.description:
Dead End is survival-horror strategy game which pits survivors against zombies in a city-scape scenario. The world has succumbed to a laboratory-engineered super virus, bringing humanity to the brink of extinction and reanimated those who were once dead. The few who remain alive spend their days seeking out fellow survivors to help improve their chances for survival. It is a constant struggle to find sufficient food, tools, and--relatively safe--shelter.

Your story begins with your vehicle having just broken down in the middle of Sanctuary City. You must now wander the streets looking for replacement parts to repair your vehicle. During your trek, you will encounter roadblocks, lootable buildings, and countless zombie hordes. As you progress, your team will be faced with game-changing choices: does your team stop to rest and recuperate, risking the chance of a zombie attack, or move on? Do you split off from your group to check out that side-street, or stick together to better your survival odds? Meanwhile, the zombie player's hordes lurk around every corner, to ensure no one gets out alive.

Using a simplified dice-rolling system, Dead End allows for in-depth strategy and variety without bogging down the game in rules and exceptions. This allows the game to be fun and exciting for players of all ages.
129576.name: Dead End: An Adventure Strategy Game. With Zombies.

129577.name: It Lurks Below
129577.description:
From the front cover:

A mournful girl has begged you for aid. Her father, keeper of the city's vast sewer system, has disappeared. The city guard will do nothing and she suspects foul play or possibly something even more sinister. An adventure is at hand and only one thing is certain, It Lurks Below!

It Lurks Below is an adventure for four to eight first level characters using the First Edition game rules.

129578.name: Wolsung: Steam Pulp Fantasy (English Edition)
rpghonor: 2013 ENnie for Best Writing - Nominee
129578.description:
Back of the book:
Wolsung: Steampulp Fantasy is a roleplaying game of cinematic action set in the daring times of the Magical-Industrial Revolution.

Welcome to the fantastic 19th Century! Under the sky crowded with airships, steam-powered cars race the streets. The Marriage of Magic and science gave birth to mechanical golems, cabalistic thinking machines and fearsome iron dragons. Yet most of the world is still unexplored - who knows what treasures and mysteries await deep in the jungles and high on the mountain tops. In the dark corners of the Earth the undead lurk - a terrible reminder of the Great War - while villains and evil masterminds plot their deranged plans.

These daring times demand Extraordinary Ladies and Gentlemen. The Characters in Wolsung are: ingenious detectives, investigators, secret agents, famous explorers, burglar gentlemen, magical engineers, fearless hunters, controversial writers, and wealthy collectors. True celebrities of the Steam pulp world.

We have prepared for you over 500 pages of steam pulp excitement! In the book you will find:

A vibrant and captivating world, an ideal setting for pulp adventures.
An easy-to-learn set of rules designed to bring the thrills of action movies and video games straight to your gaming table.
8 races, 4 archetypes, 19 professions, and over 90 Edges, allowing you to create an unforgettable character.
Over 160 amazing technomagical gadgets.
Over 120 adversaries for your characters.
A ready-to-play scenario, detailed outlines of two campaigns and 31 scenarios, and more than 200 ideas for adventures.

129579.name: Memory-Extra Picturebook Girls
129579.description:
Each player chooses a story. Shuffle the 32 cards and place them face down on the table. The oldest player begins the game by looking one of the cards. If the card is part of his story player takes it and puts it in his book of images. The player may continue his turn until he looks the card not belonging to his story. He shows the card to other and ends his turn. The first player who completed his picture with 8 cards is the winner.
remarks:
pretty same game approach like Memo Extra Picturebook Boys, but different box, materials & target group

129580.name: Dangerous
129580.description:
User Summary

Dangerous is a complex space-sim game featuring interstellar trading, elaborate ship-loadouts, robust upgrading, and a ton of detail. The game follows the story of "Dangerous," a war-criminal whose sentence includes the loss of his surname.

129581.name: Autumn Dynasty
129581.description:
User Summary

Autumn Dynasty is a Real-time Strategy game set in Feudal Japan. It follows the story of Hsu, a royal scholar beset by rebel forces and rescued by General Li. Hsu rises to prominence when he rallies Li's troops during a surprise attack that takes place while the general is away.

129582.name: Searchers of the Unknown Target d20
129582.description:
user summary

Target d20 version of the SotU rules - minimalistic old school way of playing Dungeon & Dragon modules.

129583.name: Searchers of the Unknown d20 Style
129583.description:
user summary

Standard D20 version of the SotU rules - minimalistic old school way of playing Dungeon & Dragon modules.

129585.description:
Zombies, Elves, Robots, Pirates, Aliens, Ninjas & Gunslingers. Only one can be the best!

Each race has a unique victory condition that requires either getting their pawns to specific spots on the game board, or affecting the other players pawns a certain number of times. The races also each have unique powers that they can use each turn.

The players play cards from their hand to bring their pawn into play, move them about the board, and perform special actions, depending on their chosen race. The first player to complete their goal wins.
129585.name: Zerpang!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 24 Hey! You Got Euphoria In My Dystopia!

129586.name: Germ Crazy
129586.description:
Back of game box

Germ Crazy is a real-time medical battle set within the human body. You play the role of an adventurous (and very small!) doctor whose task it is to enter your brother's body to do battle with the common cold as you have never seen it before. Armed only with a box of man-sized tissues (and the latest medical technology) you must cure this virus before it makes a four-course meal out of his major organs. Panic as your medical support team discovers that $3.50 does not go far enough on private health care and that life support machines are in short supply on the "Black Market".

129588.name: Nexus: Kingdom of the Winds
129588.description:
Discover the hidden beauty of The Kingdom of the Winds. Enter a virtual world. Begin by learning how to survive; you may end by becoming a deity.

Do arcane mysteries entice you? Or poetic stories? What of donning stunning platemail and hefting up the sword nearly lost from beneath the waves of human consciousness? Or is it simply the riches and awesome artifacts you wish to behold? Allow the winds of your imagination to rise up.

Source: The Game Website.

129589.name: Shattered Galaxy
videogamehonor: 2001 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Winner
2001 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Winner
129589.description:
Shattered Galaxy, the world's first published massively multiplayer online real-time strategy game, combines the excitement of real-time strategy with the character development of role-playing in a persistent online world.
When you play Shattered Galaxy, you enter a community of thousands of gamers like yourself. Fight with hundreds in an ever-evolving universe!
Discover new friends, new strategies and new technologies!
Advance to greatness in the only massive online warfare
experience available.

Source: The Game Website.

129590.name: Robo Smasher
129590.description:
Robo Smasher is a free online multi-player game that combines third-person shooter action with block-moving strategy. Download the game now and start smashing!

Source: The Game Website.

129591.name: Clustar
129591.description:
User Summary

Clustar is a puzzle game for either the iPhone or for Andoid and is created by Kru Interactive.

The player may move, rotate, and place energy spheres to deliberately light up faded stars. Forming squares of the same colour yields points; the larger the square, the greater the reward.
Failure results from having no further moves to make (i.e. energy spheres can not be placed anymore).

129592.name: Eidolon: The Electrodyne Opera
129592.description:
Eidolon is a 366 full-colour book. It is entirely dedicated to bringing the campaign setting to life, and the rules are made available for free through a link you will receive upon purchase. The rules are meant to be a living document, meaning that there will be no more editions and erattas, but rules will be updated as players break and make the game.

There are no rules within this book, but a link to a live document is available through http://bit.ly/Dramaturgy - this division of rules and setting into a live document and a published book will help rules change and adapt as the games unfold.

NB: Hardcover copies will be available to order December 2014.


Eidolon is a gaslamp fantasy setting, set in the year 1900. It is a world where stories focus upon the nobility and the affairs of state. Herein, the eight great nation-states of the Realm and the alien powers of both the hinterlands and antipodes acknowledge the sovereignty of the imperial Coronal. A celestial family of puissant nobles leads the Imperium, each of whom has attained near-immortality and stand at the centre of the Realm’s web of intrigue. The emperor is none other than Friedreich Münchausen, known better by the title of the Invictus.

In Eidolon, the people enjoy a sophisticated technology buoyed by the uncanny advancements of alchemical forges and electrodyne engines; their artefaction precipitating an age of wonder. Newton’s fulmonry has opened the starry heavens, having launched the space race of the 17th Century, and the Imperium now enjoys colonies on the planetary gears of Barsoom and Amtor. Alchemical contraceptives ushered in the sexual revolutions of the 1860s, creating robust libertine affects throughout contemporary society. The burgeoning vogue of planetary and science heroes has divided the generations, with the aristocracy cleaving to baroque mores, even as the bourgeoisie embrace avant-garde vogues.

Thus, the Electrodyne Opera is a drama of politics, a game of thrones, and a work of blood and thunder. It celebrates the lives of the nobility in romance and tragedy, exalting their best and revelling in their worst. For each noble contends with his or her own fate, bound as they are to the mythic force known as the skein, making their life a passion play striving for immortality and apotheosis.

129593.name: Bobcat of Futureville
129593.description:
Monopoly with a Bobcat construction equipment theme.

From the box: With Bobcat of Futureville, you too can live the life of a Bobcat dealer. Purchase Bobcat of Futureville and other dealerships for your chnace to lead the market. Achieve Brand Orange facility status and dig your way to Bobcat of Dealertown. Add another sales specialist and increase your market share and win money! But gamble wisely--if you land in the wrong neighborhood, you could be buying trucks and trailers from the dealer next door. Worse, if you don't take care of the customer, it'll cost you.

boardgameimplementation: Heavy Gear Blitz! Field Support Guide
129594.description:
"Three days have passed since Marabou, home of the Southern MILICIA, was obliterated by the CEF. Today, Earth forces descend on Terra Nova, blackening the skies, as thousands upon thousands of drop pods block the rays of Helios from reaching our planet.

People of Terra Nova, we stand on the precipice of destruction. They have come, uncaring, inhumane, and relentless. But they will be stopped.

For those who have died, for those who will die and those who will be opposed, we must fight back. We will prevail!"

- Field Commander Miranda Petite in an address to Black Talon Forces, TN 27 Summer 1950

The next few days will decide the fate of the planet, and although few know it, the fate of the galaxy and of humankind rests on Terra Nova.

This Full-Color, 54-page book is a campaign supplement for the Heavy Gear Blitz! Locked & Loaded Rulebook, and requires it as well as Black Talon: Return to Cat’s Eye for play. It also requires the use of six-sided dice and Dream Pod 9 Heavy Gear miniatures. For two or more players, ages 8 and up.
129594.name: Shattered Peace: The War for Terra Nova Book 1

boardgameimplementation: Heavy Gear Blitz! Field Support Guide
129595.description:
Terra Nova Gambit - The War for Terra Nova Book 2 includes:


Background Information on the CEF's Utopian Colonial Corp allies.
Utopian uniforms, ranks, insignia, and equipment.
Technical data on the Armiger Auto Control Suit and the Neural Kinetic Interceptor Drone Unit (N-KIDU) autos.
Technical data on the refitted HC-3 Command & Reconnaissance vehicle.
Rules for fielding Utopian Colonial Corp armies and the new CEF HC-3 combat group.
New Regiments of Note for the CEF, Utopia, and Black Talon.
Advanced League and campaign rules.
Campaign scenarios for the Barrington Basin, TN orbit, and the new PAK front.
Discover the fate of Col. Arthur and the PAK.
League Advancement Rules and Survivor Upgrade guidelines.
Timeline Narratives set during the War for Terra Nova.
Datacards for all vehicles presented in the book.
129595.name: Terra Nova Gambit: The War for Terra Nova Book 2

boardgameimplementation: Heavy Gear Blitz! Field Support Guide
129596.description:
Aftershocks and political fallout from the Interpolar War and the destruction of Peace River have left Terra Nova reeling. With Earth identified as the culprit, Terra Nova's governments have resolved to never to be caught off guard again and the Black Talon program was formed for the purpose of being sent off planet to recon Earth’s former colony worlds. Their first mission is the gate world Caprice, with its orbital fleet yards that were the staging grounds for the first attack on Terra Nova. They have the training and equipment with which to observe and sabotage Earth's Colonial Expeditionary Force (CEF) wherever opportunities arise and gain new allies whenever possible.

But it was not enough. The CEF is hell-bent on recapturing control of the colonies and has the largest fighting force in human history. War is coming, a war beyond anything that we've seen before. The fate of Terra Nova is held by an elite few, and they shall determine the fate of mankind.

Black Talon, Return to Cat’s Eye includes full army lists for Earth's Colonial Expeditionary Force, Caprician Forces and Terra Nova's own Black Talons. Also included within this book:

- Full backgrounds on all three armies presented in the book.
- Options for Terra Novan Armies post TN1940.
- Additional terrain and table effect rules for battlefields across the galaxy.
- A continued timeline covering from where Locked & Loaded left off to the beginning of the Battle for Terra Nova.
- An overview of the opening stages of the Battle for Terra Nova.
- Newly re-organized Datacards for all variants to date, for easier play.
- Rules and Guidelines for uneven Threat Value games and story-driven engagements.

This is a 124 page supplement for Heavy Gear Blitz! Locked & Loaded, and requires it for use. Also requires a few six-sided dice and Dream Pod 9 miniatures. For two or more players, ages 8 and up.

Soft Cover, ISBN: 978-1-897460-18-4
129596.name: Black Talon: Return to Cat's Eye

129597.description:
The new Heavy Gear Blitz Field Manual - Core Rulebook Companion is a rules supplement that adds a new and exciting style of game play to Heavy Gear Blitz! This book takes the field test rules featured in the first 3 issues of the Gear UP eZine and revises the Locked & Loaded rulebook sections with new rules flow charts for ease of use and new datacards for the Heavy Gear Blitz! miniatures.

- New Heavy Gear Blitz! rules section layout with flowcharts for quicker game play.
- Scenario generator with army priority levels, terrain, deployment, objectives, and support options.
- New army combat group options, Blitz options, and Field manual TV adjustments for earlier releases.
- New Gear options: Wildcat, Copperhead, Gladiator, and Boa.
- Model perks & flaws, weapon traits & tables, plus a weapon recognition chart.
- Updated datacards from HGB!: Locked & Loaded, Return to Cat's Eye, Shattered Peace, Terra Nova Gambit, Operation Drop bears: Dive!, and Gear UP issues 1 - 4.

Reduced size versions of this new primary 'core' rule booklet come packaged with certain larger miniatures boxed sets.
boardgameversion: Dream Pod 9 full color e-book edition
Dream Pod 9 full color revised e-book edition
129597.name: Heavy Gear Blitz! Field Manual: Core Rulebook Companion
boardgameexpansion: Heavy Gear Blitz! Blood Debt; Peace River Army List
Heavy Gear Blitz! Field Support Guide
Heavy Gear Blitz! Forged in Fire; Southern Field Guide
Heavy Gear Blitz! Lion's Wrath: Northern Army List
Heavy Gear Blitz! Operation: Drop Bears Dive!
Heavy Gear Blitz! Perfect Storm: NuCoal Field Guide

129598.description:
Publisher description:

Dragons Clutch - Denizen Box - expand your collection with this single summoning point worth of dragon whelps and critters from the original boxed game.

Box text:

Mighty Starfire has roamed the halls and carved stone of the Dragon Back Peaks for centuries. As much as he enjoys the admiration of his Kobold minions, it is his own children that most delights this ancient beast, as they bicker over the bones of would-be adventurers.

This expansion includes:
7 fully assembled Soda Pop Miniatures, Monster game cards and an unique Dragon's Clutch Treasure Card
129598.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Dragon's Clutch

129599.name: Moral x Mold
129599.description:
Translated box black blurb

School Order Rep has come to investigate any personal items student have brought to school. As a student, you must treat the Order rep correctly so as to avoid punishment.

How?

Well, by seeing to that your BL fanzines aren't "unnecessary" items, of course!

User summary
A simple card game consisting of different types of attractive boys, guys and men (anime style). Players take turns being the Order rep, who decides what preferences are OK, and the remaining players (students) try to play their cards so that they match them as much as possible. A game of deduction and creative guessing. And laughs.

The game also comes with identical rules called "Model Men", where the players try to guess what combination of model will sell the next fashion mag.

129600.name: Stop & Go
129600.description:
The aim of the game is to remove the traffic sign cards from the game board. The player who has gathered most cards is the winner.

Before starting to play, shuffle the 24 cards well and place them on the fields with the blue side upwards and with the poles of the sign posts pointing all in the same direction. No card should be placed on the field with the traffic lights. This field is used to place the pieces. Now agree on a player who starts, and then alternate clockwise. The player whose turn it is throws the dice and forwards his piece on the game board by the number of pips. After starting the game, the field with the traffic lights must not be entered again. You may move in all directions but not diagonally. During a move you may change the direction as often as you want. However, you have to keep two things in mind: you must not move on to a field twice during a move, and at the end of the move you must not arrive at the starting field. Bad luck, if you throw a six, because you will have to miss this turn. If a move ends on a field with a card, you have to guess which of the two signs shown on the blue side is displayed on the yellow side of the card. Subsequently look whether the traffic sign you think is shown on the yellow side. If the guess was correct, the player may take the card. The player places this card with the blue side upwards in front of himself. If the guess was wrong, the player has to return the card to the same place on the game board. If one card only is left on the game board, the player whose turn it is may throw the dice twice and move. If this card has been removed as well, every player counts his cards. The winner is who has most cards.

129601.description:
A game in the ASLComp series by Critical Hit.

Subject: the Allied Operation Epsom (aka First Battle of the Odon), Normandy, France 1944. Centered around battles near the town of Gavrus.

This is a remake of Scotland the Brave I. As such it contains the same original 9 scenarios, and 1 campaign game, with some minor alterations. The game features new map and counter art.

This game allows you to recreate firefights between British and German troops in Normandy 1944, on a tactical scale: individual vehicles, artillery pieces, support weapons, squads and leaders.
The terrain lends itself for a mixture of close quarter battles around villages and bridges, coupled with long range tank duels, due to the relatively flat, open area with little or no hedges (bocage).

Because of the designer's research and availability of detailed sources on the depicted actions, the scenarios have a highly historically informative value, backed by information and pictures of some of the landmarks in the designer's notes booklet.
129601.name: Orders For The Major: The Battle Of Normandy 1944

129602.description:
A game in the ASLComp series by Critical Hit.

Subject: the Allied Operation Epsom (aka First Battle of the Odon), Normandy, France 1944. Centered around battles near the town of Grainville-sur-Odon.

This is a remake of Scotland the Brave II. It contains 12 scenarios, and 2 campaign games, mostly the same as in the original, but with additions (most notably scenarios #21 and #22) and some minor alterations. The game features new map and counter art.

This game allows you to recreate firefights between British and German troops in Normandy 1944, on a tactical scale: individual vehicles, artillery pieces, support weapons, squads and leaders. Combining this game with Orders For The Major, you can play on a large area (campaign games), like in the original combination of Scotland the Brave I + II.

The terrain lends itself for a mixture of close quarter battles around villages and bridges, coupled with long range tank duels, due to the relatively flat, open area with little or no hedges (bocage).

Because of the designer's research and availability of detailed sources on the depicted actions, the scenarios have a highly historically informative value, backed by information and pictures of some of the landmarks in the designer's notes booklet.
129602.name: Shout For PIATS: The Battle Of Normandy 1944

129603.description:
In the small town of Palermo a series of murders are disturbing the peaceful citizens. Mafia is everywhere and every night the number of victims grows higher. The citizens of Palermo try to discover the culprits. But who can they trust? Noone knows who may be behind the murders. One thing is certain though:

Everybody has a role to play in this story!

Palermo: The Big Cleanup is a new version of the well known party game (known mostly as Werewolf) in which the innocent citizens try to dig out the mafia members among them. What makes this game different from most of the other Werewolf versions out there is that ALL the innocent citizens have a hidden role with a special ability that will help them identify the criminals. Moreover, action cards handed to the players give them more options to gather information, bluff or discover identities!

But when you trust noone, how effectively can you use all that?


Στην ήσυχη πόλη του Παλέρμο μια σειρά από δολοφονίες διαταράσσουν την ηρεμία των πολιτών. Η Μαφία έχει απλώσει τα δίχτυα της και κάθε βράδυ ο αριθμός των θυμάτων μεγαλώνει.Οι πολίτες του Παλέρμο πασχίζουν να ανακαλύψουν τους ενόχους. Όμως ποιον να εμπιστευτούν; Κανείς δεν ξέρει ποιος μπορεί να κρύβεται από πίσω. Ένα είναι σίγουρο όμως:

Όλοι παίζουν κάποιο ρόλο σε αυτή την ιστορία!

Το "Παλέρμο: Το Μεγάλο Ξεκαθάρισμα" είναι μια νέα εκδοχή του γνωστού παιχνιδιού παρέας στο οποίο οι αθώοι πολίτες προσπαθούν να ανακαλύψουν τους μαφιόζους ανάμεσα τους. Σε αντίθεση όμως με άλλες εκδόσεις του παιχνιδιού, εδώ ΟΛΟΙ οι αθώοι πολίτες έχουν ένα δικό τους ρόλο με μια κρυφή ιδιότητα που θα τους βοηθήσει να ανακαλύψουν τους ενόχους. Επιπλέον, κάρτες ενεργειών δίνουν νέες δυνατότητες για συλλογή πληροφοριών, μπλόφες και αποκαλύψεις ενόχων!

Όταν όμως κανείς δε μπορεί να επιστευτεί κανέναν, πόσο αποτελεσματικά θα μπορέσετε να αξιοποιήσετε όλα αυτά;
129603.name: Παλέρμο: Το Μεγάλο Ξεκαθάρισμα

129604.name: GURPS Character Sheets
129604.description:
User summary

This pack contains:

A booklet with 12 double-sided character sheets, 2 double-sided GM Control Sheets for listing characters and NPCs and 2 double-sided Grimoire Sheets.
One sheet of Cardstock Heroes (Skeletons, Zombies, Vampires, Bats, Werewolves, Ghosts, Mummies, Giant Zombie, Giant Skeleton and adventurers).
A full color cover sheet
A small slip of paper stating that the cover lists more cardstock giant undead than are included, and that the two additional ones can be downloaded for free.

129605.name: Crystal Clash: Light vs Darkness
129605.description:
Crystal Clash is an easy-to-pick-up yet tremendously strategic card game for two players. One player picks the Light Deck and the other plays the Darkness Deck.

The goal of the game is to bring your opponent down to zero Crystals in their Crystal-Pool.

Each player starts with 10 Crystals (represented by 10-sided dice) and plays Characters, equips them with magical Relics and has them perform powerful Abilities. Your Crystals double as "Life Points" and resources.

At the beginning of your turn you draw 3 cards from your deck, then you may discard a card from your hand and add a number of Crystals to your Crystal-Pool equal to the Crystal Value of the discarded card (which doubles as cost to play the card from your hand). Then, in Main Phase, you may play Characters and Relics and have your Characters attack the opponent. Each unblocked attack results in 2 Crystals being removed from your opponent's Crystal Pool. If at any point a player has no more Crystals left in their Pool, they lose the game immediately.

Crystal Clash consists of two preconstructed, well balanced decks with 40 UNIQUE cards each. All the cards are illustrated in Anime-Style by Manchen Yang (the Darkness Deck) and Laurie Thomas (the Light Deck).


This game is a cooperative effort by Andreas Propst and Nora Propst, Andreas' younger sister.

If you want to take a look at all 40 different Darkness Cards please visit

http://ap.o-nan.org/2012/11/crystal-clash-darkness-deck-all-...

If you want to take a look at all 40 different Light Cards please visit

http://ap.o-nan.org/2012/11/crystal-clash-light-deck-all-car...

129606.name: Der Löwe ist Los
129606.description:
Children's game that is very much in the camp of a favourite German game called Malefiz ('Barricade in English').

Each player gets two identical playing pieces. The board features paths from the bottom up to Pride Rock at the top. But the paths get closer together as they go up the board which results in playing pieces getting a little tight to move. Thus, if you land exactly on another playing piece, that piece must return to the bottom row and start again.

Movement is by a die (that includes a spot symbol on two faces). Should you roll a spot you can place a jungle maker on to the board. Or, you can move one on the board to a new location. These jungle markers are blockers which cannot be jumped.

The winner is the first player to get one of his pieces on to the Pride Rock square by an exact throw of the die.

129607.name: Battleforce Bravo Random Town Maps
129607.description:
From the introduction:

The maps in this supplement are designed to be printed out on card stock, trimmed and then placed in any manner you wish, to create different towns for use in Battleforce Bravo, or any other WWII game.

129608.name: Brains & Brawn (basic edition)
129608.description:
from the darkshire site

A generic rules-lite superhero RPG. Action resolution uses a hand of three dominoes for each player, resolving by attribute + skill + the "good" side of the domino played vs difficulty plus the "evil" side of the domino. Character creation is open point-based. 20 pages of rules.

129609.name: Foreclosed!
129609.description:
After years of taking advantage of hotel guests and tenants, Wealthy Uncle Moneybag's financial empire has crumbled into foreclosure. The millionaire's lavish property must be sold off to satisfy his debts, and you are one of the creditors! You may not need a diamond-encrusted watch or a rare fossil collection, but with 2-6 creditors sniffing around, maybe you should just take all that you can grab?!

Playing a round of Foreclosed! is simple, but the strategies are endless. Each turn, you'll be awarded a single item from Wealthy Uncle Moneybag's outrageous collection. If you receive some expensive silverware which you're not interested in collecting, and another player has received the fancy automobile you had your eye on, just make that player an offer.

If the other player wants to keep their item, they'll be forced to "protect" it by paying more money than you offered them. If a player does not have enough money, or does not want to spend the money they have, they must accept your offer. Once all players have had a chance to make offers, the round ends and all acquired items are added to their new owner's collection. Sometimes you will find it is just as rewarding to force other players to spend their money protecting items you didn't really want in the first place!

Foreclosed! lasts thirty minutes and can be played by 2-6 players.

For added depth and challenge to the game, Foreclosed! includes action cards for experienced players.

•••

Vasaran Alla - peli ahneille neuvottelijoille.

Hyvin suosittu ja rikas filmitähti on tehnyt yllättäen henkilökohtaisen vararikon! Koko omaisuus on menossa pankeille ja muille velkojille. Sinä olet yksi velkojista ja olet menossa velkojien kokoukseen neuvottelemaan omaisuuden jaosta. Vastassasi on muita ahneita velkojia, jotka eivät tunne sääliä kun on kyse kullasta, kiinteistöistä ja antiikkiesineistä.

Tehtävänäsi on haalia itsellesi mahdollisimman arvokkaat omaisuudet ja arvoesineet. Filmitähden omaisuus on jaettu 5 ryhmään; kiinteistöihin, autoihin, arvoesineisiin, antiikkiin ja sekalaiseen ylellisyysomaisuuteen. Lisäksi jaossa on riihikuivaa rahaa. Pesänhoitaja jakaa omaisuutta velkojille määrällisesti tasaisesti, mutta laadussa voi olla eroja. Omaisuutta jaettaessa voit suorittaa vaihtoja muiden velkojien kanssa, tai suojautua muiden vaatimuksilta lakimiehesi (=rahan) avulla. Mitä enemmän saman sarjan arvotavaraa ja -omaisuutta keräät, sitä tuottoisamman kokonaisuuden saat. Istu pöytään, omaisuuden jako alkaa!

129610.name: Dungeonslayers-X (Beta)
129610.description:
From Introduction:

DS-X 2012 spielt in der Gegenwart und ist motiviert durch fantastische Spiele, Filme und Rollenspiele wie Conspiracy-X, X-Com oder Akte-X (Fringe, Warehouse 13,...).

Stell Dir vor, all die urbanen Legenden von Außerirdischen, uralten Zivilisationen und Verschwörungen auf höchster Ebene wären wahr. Natürlich weiß das kaum einer, und das soll so bleiben.

Ihr arbeitet für eine Organisation wie das FBI, Majestic-12 oder die Illuminaten. Euer Job ist es Beweise für die Vorkommnisse zu suchen und auf der anderen Seite verschwinden zu lassen.

Generell liegt es beim Spielleiter und den Spielern, wie Ihr das Setting anlegt. Wer gerne taktisch-kampflastige Einsätze erleben will, der spielt eine Organisation wie X-Com auf Alien-Hatz. Detektive und Mystiker spielen à la Scully und Mulder. Oder Ihr spielt einfach irgendwas dazwischen und jagt urbane Legenden, wie den Riesen-Alligator in der Kanalisation oder Poltergeister wie die Ghostbusters.

Die Wahrheit ist irgendwo in Euch!

Das System ist offen in jede Richtung, denn warum sollte es nicht wirklich Vampire, Elfen oder Magier geben. Grundsätzlich vorgesehen sind die aber nicht. Aber es steht den Spielern und Spielleitern frei sich an Ausrüstung, Talenten oder Rassen anderer DS-Systeme, wie Caera, GammaSlayers oder ZombieSlayers zu bedienen.

Um es erfahrenen Spielern leichter zu machen, sind alle Talente und Paranormalen Fähigkeiten, die eine direkte Entsprechung im Grundregelwerk haben gekennzeichnet (DS), dies erleichtert bei Rückfragen oder Errata das Suchen ungemein.


Translation courtesy of Google:

DS-X 2012 set in the present and is motivated by great games, movies and role playing games like Conspiracy-X, X-Com X-Files (Fringe, Warehouse 13, ...).

Imagine all the urban legends of extraterrestrials, ancient civilizations and conspiracy at the highest level were true. Of course, hardly anyone knows this, and should remain so.

You are working for an organization like the FBI, Majestic-12 or the Illuminati. Your job is to look for evidence of the events and make them disappear on the other side.

Generally it is up to the players and match officials, as you applies the setting. Who wants to live like tactical combat-heavy missions, which plays an organization like X-Com on alien hunt. Detectives and mystics play à la Mulder and Scully. Or simply play something in between hunts and urban legends, such as the giant alligator in the sewer or poltergeists as the Ghostbusters.

The truth is somewhere in you!

The system is open in each direction, for why it should not really be vampires, elves and magicians. In principle, provided that is not. But it is the players and match officials to operate freely on equipment, talents or other breeds DS systems, as Caera, gamma layer or layers zombie.

To make it easier for experienced players, all paranormal talents and abilities that have a direct counterpart in the rulebook are marked (), making it easier for queries or errata searching immensely.

129611.name: Monetura
129611.description: The board game, Moneture, illustrates operation of the National Bank of Serbia under inflation targeting regime. Players take the role of the Governor and apply appropriate measures to influence the actual situation, win or lose the number of points and maintain inflation within the target range. The points to be won in the game represent success features: inflation value, dinar value and public trust. In addition, for membership in the EU monetary system, three conditions have to be met (Price Stability, Financial Stability and Independence of the National Bank). The winner of the game is the player who first completes all the specified tasks and reaches the end of the inner circle of the board - average inflation of the European Union.

129612.name: The Amazing Adventures of Fibber McGee
129612.description:
"A hilarious party game for any number of players. A riot of fun for everyone - take it from me! - Fibber McGee

...by Arrangement with the National Broadcasting Co. Inc."

A large deck of yellow cards are placed face down on a table in a loose spread out pile. Each card has a few words that make up a partial sentence on them.

One player reads a story out of a booklet and when the reader encounters a blank line ("_______") in the story, they pause and another player quickly draws a card and reads what is on it, then the reader continues.

For example, "My first encounter came after a series of lessons from _A_perforated_fire_hose_ who had slain nine thousand bulls."

Some cards have points on them, so the player who drew that cards would get some points. When all cards have been drawn, the points are tallied and a winner determined.

129613.name: Classroom Deathmatch (Update)
129613.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kidnapped by the government and transported to a mysterious battleground, 50 high school students are forced to fight to the death in a brutal televised contest called Classroom Deathmatch!

From the creators of Panty Explosion comes the Indie RPG Award winning role playing game that asks tough questions and forces players to make difficult choices. A game of trust, friendship, murder and betrayal.

Welcome to Classroom Deathmatch!

Classroom Deathmatch features:

Narration fueled story gaming that rewards creativity and encourages input from all players!
50 pre-made characters. If your student dies, simply pick a new one!
100 deadly weapons to choose from, including bear traps, poisonous snakes and grenade launchers!
3 pre-made battlegrounds, each with unique dangers and escape routes!
Brutal, fast paced play designed for 1-4 sessions.
For 4 or more players.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Abstract Board Game Nominee
2013 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
2013 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Familien Recommended
2013 Spiel des Jahres Game of the Year Recommended
129614.description:
In the abstract strategy game Rondo, players try to score as many points as possible by placing tokens on numbered spaces on the game board, with the board consisting of two concentric rings of numbered spaces and multiple spokes connecting these rings and the center of the board. (The game board is double-sided, with different values on each side.) The numbers come in five colors, and players start the game by drawing two tokens (also in five colors) from a bag and placing them on a rack, thereby hiding the color of the tokens from other players.

On a turn, a player can either (1) play as many tokens as he wants in a continuous chain, with the first token being placed next to an occupied space or the center space, then drawing one token from the bag or (2) drawing two tokens and placing none on the board. A player can hold at most five tokens on his rack.

When a player places tokens, the color of the token must match the space being covered; he immediately scores the points shown on this space. A player can choose to place a non-matching token face down on a space in order to reach another space, but he scores no points for the face-down token. Alternatively, a player can play multiple tokens of the same color on a matching space and score the listed number of points for each token placed.

The game board has a number of dark grey spaces on it. The game ends at the end of the round in which all of these spaces are occupied or a player cannot draw enough tokens to complete his turn. The player with the most points wins!
129614.name: Rondo
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episodio 13 – Juegos a saco y tener muchos en el saco
Garrett's Games 344 - Rondo, Ticket to Ride Africa, and Expedition
Rondo (Schmidt Spiele): Spiele-Podcast Nr. 184

129615.description:
Dog Royal plays like its predecessor Dog in that the object of the game is for a player (or team) to move his (their) tokens from home to the target area as quickly as possible. Tokens are moved in a clockwise direction along the track on the game board according to the value on the cards played. The first player or team to move all of its tokens to the target area first wins.

What distinguishes Dog Royal from Dog are two twists: First, Dog Royal includes a number of special cards not present in the previous game. You can move 1-7 spaces, switch the location of two tokens, draw one token to another like a magnet, equal the value of the card previously played, and more.

Second, each of the four tokens controlled by a player bears a symbol – king, knight, citizen, jester – and each such token has a special power. The king, for example, cannot move more than seven spaces on a turn, so all cards with a higher value cannot be used to move the king, but the king cannot be bumped off the track by any token other than another king. (Players can choose to keep the symbols face-down and treat all tokens the same, if desired.)
129615.name: Dog Royal

129616.name: Das Cthulhu Quellenbuch
129616.description:
from the back of the book

This sourcebook for the CoC RPG gives both players and the GM alike information on the 1920s, to create more realistic and intersting adventures.
You will find:
- events and catastrophes: as seen from the mythos
- biographies of interesting personalities
- prices: ranging from a truck to a thermos bottle
- journeys in the 20s: means of transprt, prices, distances
- new rules: ranging from diving to new weapons
- new monsters: rangig from eagles to zombies
- cults and cultists, of course
- mythos books and libraries
- sages and their customs
- archaeologie: from digging techniques to floor maps

... and many abstracts, maps and hints for your adventures

additional information
this is supposed to be a revised and expanded (for information on Germany) translation of Chaosium's "A Sourcebook for the 1920s" of 1981 and 1983

129617.name: Zotch
129617.description:
A push your luck dice rolling game.

Object: "All players try to accumulate the highest number of points per turn, which uhen added to their score, gives them the necessary 10,000 points to win."

Equipment: box, instructions, scoresheets, dice cup and six dice (marked blank, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5).

Scoring: blank = 50, 1=100, 3 of a kind = varies (2-5 = die x 100, blank = 500, 1 = 1000), straight (blank, 1-5) = 1000, and 6 of a kind = 3 of a kind x 3.

129618.name: Mad Dash
129618.description:
A turn-based roll-and-move car racing game based on the zany videogame kart racing mania (Mario Kart, Crash Team Racing, etc.) Each player tries to be first to cross the finish line, but not before equipping weapons cards or playing sneaky tricks and trying to blow the competition out of their way!

The core mechanic of this game is a trade-off between going fast and equipping weapons (which reduces the speed and sturdiness of your vehicle.) Eventually, a player's car will be destroyed, at which point the player will return to the nearest checkpoint and continue racing (or just blowing up their enemies for the fun of it!)

129619.description:
Tactical land combat game based on Japanese robotech animation series Mobile Suit Gundam ZZ. The game is also covering combat in the space colony.

Each unit represent one humanoid weapons called mobile suits(MS). Unit ability is writen on the separate data cards.

Each player control one or few MS and aims at the destruction of the opponent MS.

Players writes down the plan of the movement and the battle in the log. Then, that is disclose and resolve at simultaneous.
129619.name: Mobile Suit Gundam ZZ: Side One

129620.name: Mobile Suit Z Gundam: Sign of Z
129620.description:
Tactical level wargame based on Japanese robotech animation series Mobile Suit Z Gundam. This game covering all battle field and weapons in story.

Each unit represent a mobile suit(robotech name in this universe). Unit ability is written on each unit.

The turn sequence is simple, repeat of movement and simultaneous attacking. Some special weapons covered by special rules, such　a Mega Bazooka Launcher or Funnel.

Victory condition is stated for each scenario.

boardgameimplementation: Harap Alb Continuă... un joc Love Letter
Love Letter: The Hobbit – The Battle of the Five Armies

129622.description:
All of the eligible young men (and many of the not-so-young) seek to woo the princess of Tempest. Unfortunately, she has locked herself in the palace, and you must rely on others to take your romantic letters to her. Will yours reach her first?

Love Letter is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 2–4 players. Your goal is to get your love letter into Princess Annette's hands while deflecting the letters from competing suitors. From a deck with only sixteen cards, each player starts with only one card in hand; one card is removed from play. On a turn, you draw one card, and play one card, trying to expose others and knock them from the game. Powerful cards lead to early gains, but make you a target. Rely on weaker cards for too long, however, and your letter may be tossed in the fire!

Number 4 in the Tempest Shared World Game Series
boardgameversion: English second edition in blister pack
129622.name: Love Letter
boardgamefamily: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games
