Accepts the card, says either "true" or "false", then reveals the card. If this player is wrong in her claim, she keeps the card on the table in front of her face up; if she is right, the player who gave her the card places it face up before him.



Passes the card to another player, peeking at it first, then keeping it face-down and either saying the original type of critter or saying a new type. This new player again has the choice of accepting the card or passing it, unless the card has already been seen by all other players in which case the player must accept it and make a true/false claim.


The game ends when a player has no cards to pass on his turn or when a player has four cards of the same critter on the table in front of him. In either case, this player loses and everyone else wins.

To this, Kakerlakenpoker Royal adds new rules and new nasty "royal" critters to create more options for players during the game.

Microbadge
129736.name: Kakerlakenpoker Royal
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit: Episode 46 - Council Chamber: Big Episode on Small Games

129738.name: Duell der Formen
129738.description:
Duell der Formen / Duel of Forms is a 2 player abstract strategy game. The aim of the game is to position six tokens to make a line, triangle or hexagon. The player who manages to do this first wins the game.

Each player gets 12 tokens and takes it in turns to place one of their tokens on the empty board.

Each player attempts to use 6 of the tokens of their colour to make an unbroken line, a hexagon with six equal edges or a triangle with three even edges (including placing a token in the middle of each of edges of the triangle).

If all the tokens have been set out and neither player has won, the players take it in turns to move their tokens to empty spaces. Players can only move one space and cannot jump. Each player must move a token to an empty space during their go and cannot choose to wait.

Variant: Once all the tokens have been set out, players cannot only move but also jump to any place.

129739.name: The Big Bang Theory: For Your Consideration
boardgamefamily: TV Series: The Big Bang Theory
129739.description:
Object: The object of the game is to travel from Pasedena, through the many challenges of life as a genius, and ultimately arrive in the Nomination Zone, where you might just win as Emmy.

To Begin: Play "Rock, paper Scissors, Lizard, Spock" to determine who goes first (scissors cut paper, paper covers rock, rock crushes lizard, lizard poisons spock, spock vaporizes rock, rock crushes scissors). Each player takes a turnspinning the wheel and moving forward the number of spaces the spinner lands on.

Winning The Game: The first player to reach the Emmy nomination zone wins the game and has bragging rights for one year. They must attend all parties and pose for red-carpet photos. There are no guarantees that the funniest player will win the game, or that the winner will win again next time.

129740.name: Lettres ABCZ
129740.description:
This is a kid game for learning the letters and writing in French.

There is lot of pieces in the form of different objects where the first letter of the word is in-script. There is also letter pieces.

The game have 4 levels:
1) The kid take the objects pieces and name them. The kid who name the more pieces win.
2) The kid associate the object whit the first letter piece. The kid who associate the more objects win.
3) Make pair of 2 objects starting by the same letter. The kid who make the more pairs win.
4) The kid take letters to make words write on a card. The kid who make the most words win.

This game must be play by a adult helping one or multiple kids.

129741.name: Motherload
129741.description:
Motherload!

Play the game that takes you under the surface of arcade-style gaming and into the roots of fun. Tipping the hat to old favorites such as Dig Dug and Boulder Dash, Motherload incorporates a modern interface, fast-paced gameplay, and an in-depth storyline. Experience exciting gameplay in the substrata of Mars, where you'll search for the Motherload; A fabled cache of rare and valuable minerals.

Navigate the dangers of Martian soil, complete with hidden gas pockets, earthquakes, and other surprises. Purchase powerful upgrades for your Mining Pod with the fruits of your labor. Compare high scores with friends to see who the champion really is. When you've finished the game, challenge more difficult gameplay modes.

Motherload -- Can you dig it?

Source: The Game Website.

129742.name: Motherload: Goldium Edition
129742.description:
User Summary

The Goldium Edition of Motherload is the premium CD version which includes a great array of new items and game modes. For instance, blueprints for rare accessories can be found and aid may come from strange and varied parties, including martians and angels. 12 different challenge modes exist within which to test the skill of the most astute miners.

Gameplay is similar to the original, with the player primarily drilling for valuable ores while managing hull damage and fuel levels. The greater the risk and the deeper the drilling, the greater the rewards. But, can one dig too far...?

129743.name: Hunter Hunted
129743.description:
Hunter Hunted is a side-scrolling action computer game developed by Sierra Entertainment and published on October 31, 1996. The player controls a humanoid creature (either a muscular human called Jake or a minotaur-like creature named Garathe Den) who fights enemies, completes objectives, and tries to find the hidden exit in each level. Of the two, Garathe possesses superior strength and stamina, while Jake can take advantage of more sophisticated weaponry.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hunter Hunted (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

129744.description:
Sea Titans is the 4th installment to the Arena Assault games. Battle in an arena of the future as either Iron Beard the Pirate or Megalotron. Arena Assault is a MASSIVE MULTIPLAYER CARD GAME, meaning there is no maximum number of players. You are only limited by the number of cards you have.
Despite the large number of players the game can handle, gameplay is always fast, fun and furious.
Draw your cards, choose who you want to attack and what attacks cards to play. Defenders may try to defend with defense cards, if available. All Arena Assault games include 20 gear cards. Cards that are available to all that do any number of things.
129744.name: Sea Titans

129745.name: Triovision Master
129745.description:
Triovision Master challenges players to move quickly and create certain combinations of shapes.

To start, the nine tokens – three cubes, three cylinders and three pawns, with red, blue and yellow versions of each – are placed randomly on the playing area: a field of 17 squares in a rough cross. Ten cards are revealed from the deck, with each card showing a pattern of colors and shapes in a particular arrangement. The backside of the card on top of the deck shows one of the nine tokens.

Everyone plays simultaneously. Players attempt to form one of the patterns shown on the cards by moving the specific piece indicated on the card back to any empty space on the game board. If the player does this correctly, she claims the card; if not, she's out for the round. Once someone claims a card, the top card of the deck is flipped, revealing a new pattern and the piece that now must be moved.

The first player to collect twelve cards wins.

Reimplements


Triovision

129746.name: Lylicalion
129746.description:
Translated from the box back
The circle of fate for the girls is starting to turn…

Lylicalion is a double hand management game, where the players compete for the attention of six characters from Lylican Nanoha. The players first draft themselves through the draw deck consisting of magic cards and friendship cards. Once the deck is depleted, cards drafted to a certain face down pile will be auctioned out with the cards players have in their hands. At the end of the game, for each character, the player with the highest total of friendship gains the points that character is worth.

Re-implements:

Biblios

129747.name: Chuba
129747.description:
A game in the Mancala family adapted from Tschuba with a novel starting position. Associated 1891 US patent: number 448,574.

Description following provided by Milton Bradley prior to 1897.

Chuba is an adaptation from a rude game of Eastern Africa which is greatly enjoyed by the natives, who squat on the ground, and play in holes scooped out of the sand, using shells, young coconuts, etc., for counters, which they move from hole to hole.
As now presented to the civilized world for its diversion, Chuba is a game of skill for two players. It is made up of a board with 4 parallel rows or pockets, 11 in each row, and 60 small beads used as men or counters.

...

The winner is the player who captures all his opponent's men."

129748.name: BRAAAAAINS!
129748.description:
BRAAAAAINS! is a VERY fun and fast paced card game where you take on the role of a zombie amongst a zombie horde. You are simply trying to survive by gathering enough sustenance to satisfy your insatiable hunger, and the only food you crave is BRAAAAAINS! Be wary though, Zombie hunters, and other players are waiting to disrupt your feeding frenzy!

BRAAAAAINS! has been developed for between 2 to 4 zombies ages 12+, and has an average game time between 5 and 15 minutes. It’s a great game for casual players or others who want a hilariously fun way to slaughter a little "time.

BRAAAAAINS! boasts a total of 52 cards with a lot of attention to detail and fantastic art, and even quirky tongue-in-cheek references and homages to the zombie subculture. It really does show that this has been almost a year in the making!

The deck is opened and the rules card and credits card are removed and the cards are to be shuffled.

Once the cards are shuffled well, the deck is placed center on the table, face down, and scattered around into a heap.

Once the group has decided who will go first, that person will select a card from the heap. If that card is a Brain Card, they will set that card in front of them. They can choose to pass to the next player, or keep drawing.

If the player draws an Incident Card, the player must do what the Incident Card instructs. They must also place the card back into the heap and mix the heap thoroughly.

The play continues this way for each player until a player reaches 10 brains, then that player wins!

rpgseries: MYRE - Living Forgotten Realms My Realms Adventure Packets
129749.name: Calimshan My Realms (Heroic & Paragon)
129749.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

Perhaps you would like to hear a tale? I know just the one: a story of danger and heroism in the deserts of Calimshan... A Living Forgotten Realms adventure of the DM’s devising set in Calimshan for characters of the Heroic tier (levels 1-10) or the Paragon tier (levels 11-20). This packet contains adventure hooks, Story Awards, and Treasures to allow DMs to build adventures for Heroic-tier or Paragon-tier PCs.

rpgseries: WATE - Living Forgotten Realms Waterdeep Regional Adventures
129750.name: Paying the Piper
129750.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

Stirrings of an evil cult have come to light in the Dock Ward of Waterdeep. Can you discover the source of this evil and put a stop to it before more souls are lost forever? A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Waterdeep for characters of the Heroic tier (levels 1-10).
This adventure starts the Infernal Ambitions Major Quest, which continues in WATE4-2 and concludes in WATE4-3. Playing the trilogy in order with the same character is recommended, but not required.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Deutscher Lernspielpreis Nominee
129751.name: KIPP X
129751.description:
Will the game board tip down or not? That's the question players face each turn in KIPP X, a captivating and challenging balance game that's yet easy to play. Just place a wooden block on the cross-seesaw and that's it – if it were not for the tipping.

To win KIPP X, you must be the first to get rid of all your blocks. To do this, you carefully position them one at a time on one of the lifted-up halves of the cross-seesaw. At some point, however, the weight becomes too much and the cross-seesaw tips down. If this happens, you must take any block(s) that fall off. Thus, you can't be too bold when placing blocks on the upraised planks – but maybe you can place just one more block...

Reimplements

Kippit

129753.name: A Thousand and One Nights: A Game of Enticing Stories (2012 Edition)
rpg: A Thousand and One Nights: A Game of Enticing Stories
129753.description:
[Taken from the inside front flap.]
Mysterious strangers.
Beautiful women.
Enchanted swords.
Talking camels.

You play members of the Sultan's Court, whiling away the sultry nights by telling pointed stories to advance your own ambitions.

Navigate the social maze and you could win your heart's desire; offend the wrong person and you suffer the Sultan's wrath.

A Thousand and One Nights is a game for three to six players.

[From the entry submitter.]
In 2012 a new edition of the game has been released through a indiegogo campaign. This edition contains updated content, a new layout, new artwork, and a different size.

129754.name: Diggin Deep Tennis
129754.description:
Welcome to the world of Diggin’ Deep Tennis. Diggin’ Deep Tennis is a multifaceted game, which brings the world of professional tennis right onto your tabletop. You play at the pace that suits you with Diggin’ Deep Tennis. The game engine offers a quick play mechanic in which you can resolve the action game-by-game, set-by-set, or you can even simulate an entire match in as little as one roll of the dice.

Diggin’ Deep Tennis also features a point-by-point mechanic which factors in every possible skill for the player rated. Whether it’s the big server like Andy Roddick, the great return of service game of Novak Djokovic, or fantastic all-around play of Nadal and Federer, every player will perform as they did in real life.

The point-by-point game also offers an amazing element of strategy with the Diggin’ Deep System, which allows players to dig deep for a little something extra in certain circumstances. Do you Dig Deep do attempt to break serve in the first set? Or do you wait for an opportunity later in the match? The Diggin’ Deep System brings tabletop tennis games to an entirely new level of play. The Diggin’ Deep System also makes for outstanding head-to-head play. Not to fear though, we didn’t leave solitaire players out in the cold, as the game also has a solitaire system for when to Dig Deep.

It’s match point, and time for you to Dig Deep!

129755.name: Glory on the Pitch
129755.description:
Welcome to the world of Glory on the Pitch, brought to you by Diggin Deep Sports. With Glory on the Pitch, you can re-create a full soccer match in about ten minutes, complete with the following:
Complete list of goal scorers, time of goals, and assists
Complete set of stats for selected players (Goals, Assists, Shots, Shots on Goal, Yellow Cards, Red Cards)
Complete keeper stats
In game strategies (Who to start? / When to sub? / Who to sub?)
Team Formations (Heavy offense / Heavy Defense / Balanced Attack)
For players that only play one half...Which half to play?
Individual cards means you can have draft leagues, and not be locked into stock teams.
Within five minutes, you’ll have a final score complete with total shots on goal (per half). You also have the option of tracking the stats of up to three players from each squad. An entire match along with stats for certain players can be played in about ten to fifteen minutes.

129756.name: Die Waldwanderung
129756.description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (Waldhaus = field 60)
- simple 'Roll & Move' game/ moving by turns -
each player moves his/her meeple according die roll
ending on a numbered space (1-20) follow instructions printed cover inside.
Remarks:
Printed in the GDR during 1950's

129757.name: Lexi-Cross
129757.description:
From Wikipedia: Lexi-Cross is a 1991 DOS computer game by Interplay Productions. Its premise is a futuristic TV game show, featuring elements similar to Wheel of Fortune, Scrabble, and Battleship. Players can choose to play as human or alien, and computer opponents are robots. Each player has a grid of hidden tiles concealing various hidden words. Players take turns revealing tiles in an attempt to find either letter tiles or bonuses, similarly to Battleship. Players may alternatively spin a wheel to guess a letter as in Wheel of Fortune. The words eventually comprise a theme or quotation, which the player must guess to win the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Lexi-Cross," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

129758.name: Total War: Rome II
videogamehonor: 2013 Game Critics Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Game Critics Best Strategy Game of the Year Winner
2013 Global Game Awards Best Historical Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Global Game Awards Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
129758.description:
How far will you go for Rome?

Become the world’s first superpower and command the most incredible and vast war machine of the Ancient world. Dominate the enemies of your glorious empire by military, economic and political means.

Your rise will bring admiration from your followers but will also attract greed and jealousy, even from your closest allies.

Will betrayal strike you down, or will you be the first to turn on old friends? How much are you ready to sacrifice for your vision of Rome? Will you fight to save the Republic, or plot to rule alone as Dictator — as Emperor?


The creators of the award-winning Total War series set a new benchmark for strategy gaming quality and depth, taking their signature mix of real-time and turn-based gameplay to new heights.



An epic-scale turn-based campaign mode in which to plan your conquest of the known world – in any way you see fit.


Feel the thunderous clash of battle as the Roman war-machine takes to the field in real-time combat. Tens of thousands of men collide in bone-splintering detail that you directly control.


All-new graphics engine: see exotic ancient cities and colossal armies rendered in incredible detail, while jaw-dropping cinematic battles unfold. New unit cameras allow you to see the battle from every perspective.



Completely scalable experience, with performance optimised for your PC or laptop. Witness the awesome scale of Total War: Rome II, no matter what your spec.


Source: The Publisher Website.

129759.name: Classic Moves
129759.description:
Basically a "trouble style" game with cards. Classic Moves was developed in the early 1990's by Moore and Moore Industries of London, Ontario. Players begin with 4 marbles in a "safe" zone, and they must be moved around the board to the player's "Home Base".

Movement is accomplished with a 56 card deck, with numbers 1-12, and a number of "wild" cards.

There is a centre "shortcut" that can also be utilized.

Players can also play with a partner, assisting them once their marbles are "home"

129760.name: San Juan
129760.description:
User Summary

This is the iOS implementation of the card game San Juan by Ravensburger Digital GmbH. Single player games are against up to three AI of different levels. Local and online multiplayer (GameCenter supported) are also available.

129762.name: Der Fluch des Flussvaters
129762.description:
from the back of the book

Havena, gateway to the sea of the seven winds at the mouth of the Great River, and the capital of Albernia, a hoard of ancient secrets. For centuries, the struggle of the forces of the sea god Efferd and the archdaemoness Charyptoroth goes on. Unbeknownst to the citizens of trading port who after years of war with the Northern Marks only want to restore prosperity, the shadows of the sunken undertown rise again: people disappear and ships are attacked by monstrous abominations. Even the Father of the River, Efferd's governor, who is said to have his court in the undertown, takes little notice of what is happening.

To rouse the Father of the River and avert the demon threat, the heroes must dive into the underwater world - because even in his court is undermined by enemies.
On the hunt for the henchmen of the Daughter of the Deep, the people from Thorwaler offer a real help. But what is their real agenda? Why are they so eager to break the old curse of the Father of teh River, who prevented for 2,000 years that Thorwal people travel the Great River? Finally, the heroes must make a decision about how they want be remembered by the bards: as friends or enemies of the northern people?

129763.name: Im Zeichen der Götter
129763.description:
user summary

this book contains 3 adventures on the continent of Myranor. All of them feature a certain religion or cult.

129764.name: Knights of the Dinner Table Magazine (Issue 189 - Jul 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Records of All that Should Be
Skill Rolls as Game Show Questions
129764.description:
"I Believe! I Believe!"

Cover by Marc Guerrero

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

129765.name: Khet 2.0: Eye of Horus Beam Splitter
boardgameimplementation: Khet: Eye of Horus Beam Splitter
129765.description:
Eye of Horus Beam Splitter
You've had fun with The Laser Game Khet 2.0 using one laser beam, now can you up the ante and handle three? Each Eye of Horus game piece splits one laser beam into two! Half of the beam hitting the Eye of Horus reflects, and the other half passes through, for twice the strategy and axcitement. With both game pieces in play, the beam can be split twice, blasting three lasers around the field.

Includes:
- 2x Eye of Horus Beam Splitter pieces (one silver & one red)
- Full color booklet including 5 new starting setups

129766.name: The Things in the Forest
129766.description:
From the front cover:

The Barbarian Lord and his army emerged from the Darken Wood and swarmed across the land. Eventually his army failed and the greed-driven lord retreated back to the wild lands of the north. He was never seen again. Many years later, a dark and horrific creature fell upon a peaceful valley many miles from the Darken Wood. Through the mystery of fate, these two events are directly linked. Now is the time to find and destroy The Things in the Forest!

The Things in the Forest is an adventure for four to six characters of 4th to 6th level. This module requires the use of the First Edition game rules. Designed as a sequel to T1 The Thing in the Valley, playing that module is not required, though recommended.

129767.name: Beyond the Black Wall
129767.description:
From the front cover:

Beyond the Black Wall is an adventure module for the First Edition Game, compatible with OSRIC™, and designed for a single 3rd level character. This module includes Pacesetter’s SoloSystem™ for enhanced individual play.

Your hunt for the fabled Green Flame, a jewel of unparalleled beauty and value, has led you deep into the wild. Guided by unreliable research and gut instinct you search for an ancient city that has been dead for centuries. Your only clue is that the city is guarded by a towering black wall. Somehow, you know the city must exist and that it surely harbors the Green Flame. Undaunted, you set yourself to face the horrors and dangers that lie beyond the black wall!

129768.name: The Secret of Redscar
129768.description:
From the front cover:

Redscar was not the most notorious or successful pirate in his time so when he and his ship disappeared, few gave it consideration. But a map has come into your possession that details the location of Redscar’s last target—a hidden temple of a forgotten sea god. Now, standing on the windswept cliffs overlooking a turbulent sea, your discerning eye has detected a cave mouth rising just above the crashing waves. Hidden inside that ominous cave is the Secret of Redscar!

The Secret of Redscar is an adventure for four to six characters of fifth to seventh level. This module requires the use of the Swords & Wizardry game rules.

129769.name: Goblins of Mount Shadow
129769.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Adventure Type: Overland, Dungeon, Town
Level: 1-5
Party: 2-5 characters
Setting: Portable to Home-brew

Many long years ago, the denizens of Mount Yr Wyddfa burrowed beneath the earth; foul minded fey, goblins and others of that ilk; they fled for reasons unknown to all but themselves. On the terraced slopes, the valleys, ravines and forested highlands settled in peace, farms spread along the greens, people settled and prospered. But the world unfolds, forever turning, mirroring the past. It began with nightmares, followed by haunts hounding farmers in their fields, terrorizing them on the roads, chasing them to their sanctuaries. Then the goblins came a-hunting. Not seen in many years, now they waylay travelers, despoil their belongs or worse, killing them on the road. And to all this the terror only increases, spreading even to hearth and home. Young women have begun to disappear, kidnapped from their homes. Rumors speak of a new power, called the Grey King, who settled in the mountain. It is he that stirs up the creatures and has brought the goblins to life.

Drawn by a string of random attacks on the locals, vandalism and sightings of eerie beings about the mist shrouded mountain, the characters must band together to discover the cause of this calamity. To save the local villages from further devastation, the characters will need to hunt down the goblins and find the source of their rise to power.

This set of adventures is made for characters numbering 2-5 from 1st-5th level or higher, employing a diverse band of adventurers preferably with an elf or two. The campaign centers on the haunted dark mountain of Yr Wyddfa and the rise to power of the dark faeries within, being guided and led by their mysterious leader the Grey King or the Brenin Llwyd ('Brin-in Thloo-id').

The story focuses on Celtic myth and folklore may be integrated into any fantasy setting and Aihrde with ease. The locations in this adventure are essentially fictional but taken from actual Welsh sources with only a few real place-names (Yr Wyddfa, Penllyn). The rest are contrived Brythonic locations.

129770.name: Scorned (Swords & Wizardry)
129770.description:
From the rear cover:

The PCs arrive in the bustling town of Whiterush and are hired to help solve protect a caravan from bandits. However, there is much more going on in the town than meets the eye and the PCs are in deeper than they originally thought.

(4-6 PCs of 5th Level)

129771.name: Beyond the Wailing Mountains (Swords & Wizardry)
129771.description:
From the rear cover:

The story begun in Vengeance of the Long Serpent continues. The heroes have defeated the Children of Althunak, but the fell god's evil fane survives. Strange beasts, dark magics, and unholy cold await in the lands Beyond the Wailing Mountains.

129772.name: The Death Curse of Sven Oakenfist (Swords & Wizardry)
129772.description:
From the rear cover:

In the Northlands the laws of hospitality are absolute, to violate them is to seek dishonor or even death. What then must our heroes do when their host asks them to fulfill his dying wish, to face down the wight of the legendary viking Sven Oakenfist and convince him to lift a curse laid with his own last breath?

129773.name: Seifenkistl Rennen
129773.description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (field 100)
- simple 'Roll & Move' game/ moving by turns -
each player moves his/her meeple according die roll
ending on a red space follow instructions.
Remarks:
published during 1930's in bavaria or Austria
cute pewter meeples

129774.name: Many Gates of the Gann
129774.description:
From the front cover:

Barbarous hyena-men who raid villages and kidnap girl-children? Bah! Unremarkable in our world! But when these raiders retreat safely past ancient sculptures that vaporize intruders, into heretofore unopened vaults believed to hold a weapon of primal terror, and past the gates that guard ancient treasures never beheld by man? Aye! Now these are rumors worthy of adventure! What bold souls will dare pass into centuries-old chambers protected by the Many Gates of the Gann?

129775.name: Mazes & Minotaurs Players Manual
129775.description:
From Foreward:

This second edition of Mazes & Minotaurs takes the form of three core books: The Players Manual (which you are currently reading), The Mazes & Minotaurs Maze Masters Guide and The Mazes & Minotaurs Creature Compendium.

This basic trilogy will be followed by a fourth book, the Mazes & Minotaurs Companion, which will offer a variety of options to expand the basic game.

But why a new version, you ask? And what does “revised” mean, anyway?

First, a word to all M&M veterans: it is still the same game! Nobles and priests, centaurs and sorcerers, cyclops and chimeras and, of course, mazes and minotaurs, they’re all here! The game system is the same too – except that we have streamlined, clarified and, well, revised a few things here and there, not to change the game but to make it better.

This new edition also incorporates revised material originally published in the first edition supplements, from the venerable Men & Monsters and Myth & Magic to the more recent Unveiled Addenda and Hekatoteratos… along with new, never-before-published stuff, including background material on the world of Mythika (which shall be revealed in the forthcoming Mazes & Minotaurs Maze Masters Guide)!

129776.name: Mazes & Minotaurs Maze Masters Guide
129776.description:
From Foreward:

This second edition of Mazes & Minotaurs takes the form of three core books: The Mazes & Minotaurs Players Manual, The Maze Masters Guide (which you are currently reading) and The Mazes & Minotaurs Creature Compendium.

This basic trilogy will be followed by a fourth book, the Mazes & Minotaurs Companion, which will offer a variety of options to expand the basic game.

But why a new version, you ask? And what does “revised” mean, anyway?

First, a word to all M&M veterans: it is still the same game! Nobles and priests, centaurs and sorcerers, cyclops and chimeras and, of course, mazes and minotaurs, they’re all here! The game system is the same too – except that we have streamlined, clarified and, well, revised a few things here and there, not to change the game but to make it better.

This new edition also incorporates revised material originally published in the first edition supplements, from the venerable Men & Monsters and Myth & Magic to the more recent Unveiled Addenda and Hekatoteratos… along with new, never-before-published stuff, including background material on the world of Mythika (which shall be revealed in the forthcoming Maze Masters Guide)!

129777.name: The Sparkle 2: Evo
129777.description:
User Summary

In the Sparkle 2: Evo, the player controls an aquatic lifeform that levels up by consuming the "microelements" that populate each level. These elements come in three colors - red, blue, and green - and the goal is to eat all of one color and avoid the others. Doing so advances the player's evolutionary form. Later forms are bigger, faster, stronger, and more visually impressive. The Sparkle 2 features rich colors and relaxing music, and is described as a "relaxation game" by the publisher.

129778.name: Mazes & Minotaurs Creature Compendium
129778.description:
From Foreward:

The book you are holding in your hands is the ultimate Mazes & Minotaurs bestiary.

The Creature Compendium gives you the fully Revised game stats of more than 200 creatures (no, we didn’t have the courage to count them all !), including all your old favorites from the original 1972 M&M rules, Men & Monsters and (of course) the Hekatoteratos, as well as many creatures from the Creature Compendium column of Griffin magazine and some new, never-before published monsters!

But that’s not all. Every creature described in these pages has its own illustration - something that had never been done before, which makes this book something of a world première (well, as far as RPG bestiaries are concerned). No longer will you have to wonder about the appearance of the Acteon, the Ichtyocentaur, the Chimera or the Quinotaur (not to mention the Bucentaur or the Catoblepas). This is 1987 and roleplaying game has come a long way since its humble beginnings, back in 1972.

129779.name: We the People: Fight Tyranny
129779.description:
The game contains 500 history cards from five categories which explore the "people, events, documents, principles and faith that have contributed to the founding of the United States". Each card provides 'content-rich' answers (and pictures) that are sourced from over 100 books and 100s of online resources.

The game not only teaches America's history, but the humor in the game board and "social justice" cards draw a clear contrast between the founding roots of this country and the direction the nation has taken over the past 100 years. The game was added to Glenn Beck's Marketplace in August, 2013. http://marketplace.theblaze.com/we-the-people-games-home

Players advance their pawns along the outside "semi-capitalist" square track until they lose their starting cash. They are then required to mortgage their home and move to the inside circle or "path of social justice." Stars are earned by answering the history cards correctly and lost through porkulus taxes. The objective of the game is to be the player with the most stars when the first player goes broke on the inside track. The game takes about 1.5 to 2 hours to play.

129780.name: SotU * Refired
129780.description: SotU * Refired (originally, Re-Searchers of the Unknown) is a one-page old school inspired rpg, based on SotU. It adds races (elves, dwarves, and men), classes (fighters, thieves, and wizards) with different movement rates, helmets, additional weapons, and rules for spellcasting.

129781.name: SotU * Refired v 2
129781.description:
SotU * Refired (originally, Re-Searchers of the Unknown) is a one-page old school inspired rpg, based on SotU. It adds races (elves, dwarves, and men), classes (fighters, thieves, and wizards) with different movement rates, helmets, additional weapons, and rules for spellcasting.

Version 2 has slight rules changes.

129782.name: SotU * Refired v3
129782.description:
SotU * Refired (originally, Re-Searchers of the Unknown) is a one-page old school inspired rpg, based on SotU. It adds races (elves, dwarves, and men), classes (fighters, thieves, and wizards) with different movement rates, helmets, additional weapons, and rules for spellcasting.

Version 3 has some changes in rules. Demihumans vision is tuned, hp increase is faster etc.

129783.name: SotU * Refired v4
129783.description:
SotU * Refired (originally, Re-Searchers of the Unknown) is a one-page old school inspired rpg, based on SotU. It adds races (elves, dwarves, and men), classes (fighters, thieves, and wizards) with different movement rates, helmets, additional weapons, and rules for spellcasting.

Version 4 brings changes to starting equipment, saving throws and spellcasting.

129784.name: Mazes & Minotaurs Companion
129784.description:
From Foreward:

The book you are about to read could be described as “the fourth book of the trilogy”. Whereas the three Revised Mazes & Minotaurs rulebooks previously published by Legendary Games Studio (the Mazes & Minotaurs Players Manual, the Mazes & Minotaurs Maze Masters Guide and the Mazes & Minotaurs Creature Compendium), gave you all the rules needed to play countless perilous expeditions and heroic quests, the Mazes & Minotaurs Companion is a collection of optional rules on a wide variety of topics.

‘Optional’ is the key word here: each Maze Master is free to decide which of these rules they want to use in their M&M games; like all other books and modules published by Legendary Games Studio, the Companion is a fully official M&M product, but ‘fully official’ does not mean ‘mandatory’.

In keeping with the spirit of the Revised edition, most of these optional rules are streamlined or (sometimes heavily) reworked versions of rules that first appeared in original, pre-Revision supplements (like the venerable Men & Monsters and Myth & Magicor the more recent Unveiled Addenda) or in the columns of Griffin but this book also includes 100% new, never-before published material.

Many of these options take the Mazes & Minotaurs rules “beyond the labyrinth”, expanding the horizon of the game into new directions and territories, such as military campaigning, divine power plays, court intrigue or even romantic interludes, illustrating the endless possibilities offered by roleplaying games in general and Mazes & Minotaurs in particular.

129785.name: One-page Wilderness Encounter Generator for SotU
129785.description: Set of tables for a Referee to generate wilderness encounters.

129786.name: Dwarven Glory
129786.description: A OSR Minimalistic Post-Ragnarok RPG. Game is set in the Asgard, world of gods from Nordic mythos. After the Ragnarok many of the dwarven holds were lost. Players have to determine what happened to those settlements.

129789.name: Modern Day Maps
129789.description:
From publisher blurb:

With all the RPGs like d20 Modern and Spycraft hitting the gaming shelves, the only thing that you were missing was maps for your adventures.

That was until now.

Get more than 30 different modern-setting maps that can easily be used in your weekly gaming session. This product is a perfect accessory for any of the fans of d20 Modern, Spycraft, or whatever modern setting RPG you play. For less than 20 cents a map, you cannot beat the price of this product and best of all, the maps are compatible with any modern setting or genre RPG. Get everything that you and your players need and want to help expand any gaming session.

In this product, you can find the following location maps:

Airplane
Back Alley
Beach
Bowling Alley
Bedrooms
Cargo Boat
Church
Garage
Office
Restaurant
Sewers
and more!

129790.name: Karry on Krawling
129790.description: A SotU based game, where players play a non-human of villainous intent and bad reputation - orcs, goblins and trolls.

129791.name: Modern Day Maps 2
129791.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the sequel to the extremely popular Modern Day Maps. It has everything you like with 20 new maps of modern place that would be usable for any modern setting game on the market like D20 Modern and Spycraft. If you liked the first Modern Day Maps, this will be like going back home to a good old friend. This product is a perfect accessory for any of the fans of the upcoming D20 Modern, Spycraft or whatever modern setting RPG you play. For less then 30 cents a map, you cannot beat the price of this product and best of all, the maps are compatible with any modern setting or genre RPG. Get everything that you and your players need and wand to help expend any gaming session. In this product, you can find these following locations maps: Jail Cell, Junkyard, Newsroom, Fighting Octagon, Prison Shower, Prison Yard, Strip Club, and several others.

129792.name: Modern Day Maps 3
129792.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the sequel to the extremely popular Modern Day Maps. It has everything you like with 20 new maps of modern place that would be usable for any modern setting game on the market like D20 Modern and Spycraft. If you liked the first Modern Day Maps, this will be like going back home to a good old friend. This product is a perfect accessory for any of the fans of the upcoming D20 Modern, Spycraft or whatever modern setting RPG you play. For less then 30 cents a map, you cannot beat the price of this product and best of all, the maps are compatible with any modern setting or genre RPG. Get everything that you and your players need and want to help expend any gaming session. In this product, you can find these following locations maps and several others: Crime Scene (outdoor), Crime scene (indoor), Pier, Stakeout (indoor), Gun shop, Street corner, and Liquor store.

129793.name: Modern Day Maps 4
129793.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the next to the extremely popular Modern Day Maps series. It has everything you like with 19 new maps of modern place that would be usable for any modern setting game on the market like D20 Modern and Spycraft. If you liked the two Modern Day Maps, this will be like going back home to a good old friend for another time. This product is a perfect accessory for any of the fans of the upcoming D20 Modern, Spycraft or whatever modern setting RPG you play. For less then 30 cents a map, you cannot beat the price of this product and best of all, the maps are compatible with any modern setting or genre RPG. Get everything that you and your players need and want to help expend any gaming session.

129794.name: Adventurers! Exploring the Unknown
129794.description: Based on Searchers of the Unknown, another minimalistic old school way of playing D&D modules.

129795.name: Maze Master's Aegis (2012 Silver Jubilee Edition)
129795.description:
From publisher blurb:

The indispensable GM screen in glorious color.

129796.name: Vikings & Valkyries
129796.description:
From Foreward:

VIKINGS & VALKYRIES is the first instalment of the new Worlds of Adventure line of supplements for the Mazes & Minotaurs role-playing game – a line which, as its name implies, takes the Mazes & Minotaurs system away from its classic setting inspired by mythic Greece and sword-and-sandal movies to other legendary universes, each with its own deities, monsters and special rules.

Vikings & Valkyries uses the familiar and popular game mechanics of Mazes & Minotaurs to recreate the brutal action of Viking adventuring on your tabletop, complete with runes, trolls, dragon-headed ships, sword-biting berserkers and, of course,
horned helmets - which, incidentally, were never used by real Norsemen but who cares?

129797.name: Something Rotten in Novgorby
129797.description:
From Introduction:

This short Vikings & Valkyries adventure was designed with first level characters in mind.

The location of this scenario has been deliberately kept vague so it could be placed anywhere suitable for the Maze Master, either in Beornia, Havmark or Vedland (see Vikings & Valkyries, pp22-24 & 28 for more details about the Norse lands).

129799.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Reinforcements is the latest supplement for the Operation Squad WWII game. This supplement contains details on new support sections and their weapons as well as many new squads to use in the 5 exciting scenarios which have been especially designed to let you play the game on bigger tables.

From Russian Penal Squads (Shtrafniye Roti) to the infamous Hitlerjugend Volunteers (defenders of Berlin), from American Recon squads (in jeeps) to British Scout squads (and their Universal Carriers)... your games will never be the same again. The Reinforcements supplement is the same price (£18) as the other two Operation Squad books (Operation Squad and Vehicles!) and includes: -
New rules for Mortar and Machine Gun Sections
5 new scenarios – designed for playing on larger tables
New Characteristics
Card Weapon references
New vehicles - including the Churchill & Kettenkrad!
17 New Units:
American Army Recon squad
'All American' Paratrooper squad
US Glider Riders squad
British Army scout patrol
New Zealand 2nd Division rifle section
Scottish rifle section
Royal Marine Commando section
Russian Penal troops squad
Russian Sniper squad
Russian 'Black Death' Naval Brigade squad
Russian Scout squad
German Schnell squad
German Volksgrenadier squad
Hitlerjugend Volunteers squad
Waffen-SS squad
Das Reich squad
German Jager squad
You will need to have Operation Squad WWII and a copy of Vehicles! to use this 50 page, full-colour, softback supplement
129799.name: Reinforcements: A Supplement for Operaton Squad World War II

129800.name: Prinzessin Lillifee: Ein Fest für das Einhorn
129800.description:
In this Princess-Lillifee-themed children's game players try to build garlands as long as possible for the unicorn's birthday party. To do so, players have to collect cards. The 36 cards consist of two parts of different colours (some of them have the same colour on both ends). Players take turns rolling the four colour dice. Dice are then grouped into pairs of two to determine which two cards the player is allowed to take (e.g. if a player rolls orange, yellow, green and green, he/she could take an orange-yellow card and a green-green one). If a player can't use a combination to get a card, he/she removes one card from the game instead.
When all the cards have been distributed, players put together their own cardss like they would put together domino tiles, i.e. with matching ends next to one another. This part of the game is basically a solo puzzle activity.
The player who manages to put together the longest "garland" (row of cards) wins the game.

129801.name: Prinzessin Lillifee: Das Blütenfest
129801.description:
A Princess-Lillifee themed travel game for two players.

The game comes in a metal box, whose lid also functions as the game board. It shows a grid of 4x7 squares and two starting spaces. On the grid are placed 28 magnetic flower pieces. Players take turns rolling a die. If the active player rolls a flower colour, he/she may move his/her player piece (also magnetic) until it reaches a flower of the corresponding colour. Pieces may only be moved either vertically or horizontally, and it may not jump over the other player's piece or the rose piece. If it reaches a flower of the colour on the die roll, the player wins that flower. If he can't reach a flower of the current colour, he/she may move their piece to an empty space. If a player rolls the rose symbol, he gets to move the rose piece. The rose can only be plucked once all the other flowers have been taken. In this phase of the game, there are no more die rolls. Each player gets to move once per round. While the other flowers are worth one point, the rose is worth three points.
The game ends when all flowers have been plucked. The player with the most points wins the game.

129802.description: "Math Geek" is a Kickstarter exclusive expansion set for "Got It!" consisting of 12 cards with exponentiation, concatenation, factorial, and modulo operators, as well as the numbers 15-20
129802.name: Got It!: Math Geek

129803.name: I Spy Quest
129803.description:
The game is set up by inserting one of the two double sided game boards into the frame in 1 of possible 4 orientations (=16 possible configurations). Pictures will be visible through holes in the top of the frame. However, when the game begins, each of these holes is covered by a pawn.

Players take turns pulling off two pawns in an effort to find a match. Matching pictures do not match exactly in I Spy games. For example, a match might be two similar airplanes that are different colors. Or it might be an elephant toy photographed from 2 different angles.

If a match is made, the player keeps the pawns and takes another turn. If not match is made, the player puts the pawns back and the next player gets their turn.

Once all matches are revealed, the player with the most pawns wins.

There is also a set of short riddles to answer after the game for each of the 16 board configurations.

Contents: Game tray, 2 double-sided picture boards (16 game variations), reveal sheet with 16 riddles, 36 pawns

129804.name: Violet
129804.description:
Violet is a work of interactive fiction by Jeremy Freese. It is a one-room puzzle game. It took first place in the 2008 Interactive Fiction Competition with an average score of 8.53.

The protagonist of Violet is a graduate student trying to write 1,000 words for his dissertation. The protagonist's girlfriend, Violet, threatens to leave otherwise. The protagonist faces a stream of distractions, including a window with a view of the campus, and a computer with access to blogs and webcomics. In the course of the game, the protagonist must "reconsider—and risk wrecking—" his career and relationship.

Source: Wikipedia, "Violet (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

rpgseries: WATE - Living Forgotten Realms Waterdeep Regional Adventures
129805.name: Rivals
129805.description:
From the first page of the PDF:

When a rising member of the Guard begins to act strangely, her friends need your help to find out why. Can you unravel the truth before Aumarr Belbrundel ruins her career? A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Waterdeep for characters of the Heroic tier (levels 1-10).
This adventure is the second part of the Infernal Ambitions Major Quest, which began in WATE4-1 and concludes in WATE4-3. Playing the trilogy in order with the same character is recommended, but not required.

129807.description:
In Frontier Apocalypse, the world famous gunfight at the O.K Corral never happens. The night before, the unspeakable happens and the world was forever changed. Some blamed the South, some blamed the North, some blamed England, some blamed God or the Devil, but no one really knew what happened or why. But somehow humanity was able to survive the pulverizing chunks of moon rock that struck the planet; somehow humanity survived the various super volcanoes, massive radioactive solar flares and other terrible apocalyptic events. Frontier Apocalypse takes place over 100 years after that unspeakable event. In Frontier Apocalypse the Wild West never ended, it just got Wilder!

Frontier Apocalypse: The Hermit's Expedition is a solo Role Playing board/card game in the vein of games like Dungeon, Talisman, Chainsaw Warrior, and Dungeoneer. The player creates a character rolling dice, and then explores a post apocalyptic wild west by flipping cards that either reveal territories, critters, contraptions or various other events or points of interest. There are also boards to help with organization of character stats, gear and the game world. The game has several randomly chosen Expeditions that the player will need to complete with their character in order to win.Combat versus enemies is resolved by the character stats and contraptions and dice rolling. The player wins by completing their Expedition before running out of supplies or getting defeated the by various strange and weird critters who inhabit the Frontier Apocalypse world.
129807.name: Frontier Apocalypse: The Hermit's Expedition

129809.name: Syndicate 2049
129809.description:
User Summary

A unofficial fan made free download game in the Syndicate Universe. You play one agent of an syndicate. The game is an action rpg. You can choose different weapons and tactics to complete a mission.It is limited to only 2 missions but a third mission was announced.

129810.name: W Corporations
129810.description:
A Syndicate Clone from a polish game producer. Only available for mobile phones. It has 10 levels, the gameplay is reminiscent of Syndicate by bullfrog. The Story is thus : (the followinf text was taken from a pressrelease of the publisher)
In Poland everything is going bad and though this seems
to be impossible it is worse than at present. In Warsaw and Cracow two powerful corporations have been created: Wawel and Wars. Both possess the most recent discovery of science - kappa waves generators. With this equipment it is possible to convince anyone to one's own opinions.

The Player is controlling up to four agents of the Wawel corporation.

Game Features:

- Fast isometric graphics engine
- Several types of deadly weapons: uzi, minigun, rocket launcher
- Ten full of action missions, with replay ability
- Secret bonuses
- Health kits and Megahealth to pick up

Source: The Game Website.

129811.name: Elementare Gewalten
129811.description:
user summary

as the other items from the brown series, this book takes an ingame look on an aspect of magic:
elemental magic of all kinds, from djinni-summoning to fire spells and elemental planes

From the back of the book:
"Lassen Sie Ihren Schiffsmagier eine gigantische Wand aus Wasser herbeirufen, heilen Sie als Druide die Wunden Ihrer Gefährten mit der Kraft der Erde, oder schleudern Sie Ihren Gegnern Sturmböen entgegen, die sie von den Füßen holen!

Elementare Gewalten gewährt Ihnen erstmalig einen tieferen Einblick in die jahrtausendealte Kunst des aventurischen Elementarismus. In zahlreichen Quellen, Zitaten und Berichten, die ein aufstrebender Adeptus für seine Forschungsarbeit zusammengetragen hat, wird die Macht der sechs Elemente – Feuer, Wasser, Humus, Eis, Erz und Luft – greifbar gemacht.

Elementare Gewalten kann so für Sie am Spieltisch als aventurische Originalquelle dienen und enthält neben der Beschreibung neuer Wesen und berühmter Elementaristen auch Quellen zu sechs geheimnisvollen, den Elementen besonders verbundenen Orten: Das Plateau des Feuers, die versunkene Stadt Eshavar, ein lebender Wald, das Äonengrab im Ewigen Eis, die Dschinnenfestung Al’Archamud und der Ratssaal der Dreizehn Winde warten nur darauf, von Ihren Helden entdeckt zu werden.

Im Anhang finden Sie zudem Regelergänzungen zum Elementarismus, ergänzende Sonderfertigkeiten für Elementaristen, neue Eigenschaften zur spannenden Ausgestaltung von Elementarwesen und eine Schritt-für-Schritt-Anleitung für Beschwörungen. Ergänzt wird die Quellensammlung um neue Zaubersprüche, Pläne und Beschreibungen für die elementaren Orte sowie um die Spielwerte der in diesem Bund versammelten Meisterpersonen und Elementarwesen. Und natürlich können Sie in diesem Band auch mehr über die Dschinnengeborenen erfahren, die ihre Ahnenreihe angeblich auf einen leibhaftigen Dschinn zurückführen können."

129812.name: Unmechanical
129812.description:
Unmechanical is an award-winning 2.5D side-scroller which combines tricky puzzle solving, alluring exploration, and an engrossing atmosphere. The game had humble beginnings as a student project and since then both game and team has grown. Unmechanical focuses on accessible controls that makes it easy to pick up and play, and challenges you with a wide range of challenging puzzles.
On a bright and sunny day you’re spirited away by a network of coiled pipes into a mysterious underworld. You find yourself in a strange environment that pulsates from mechanic and organic machinery alike, and your journey to freedom begins. Flying freely through the odd and fantastic surroundings, a powerful tractor beam lets you pick up objects and interact with the world.
Your quest for freedom requires you to solve a great variety of puzzling challenges, and while it’s easy to pick up and play, later challenges may prove very difficult indeed. On your adventure you might also begin to understand what it all means–The underworld may be more than it seems, the fateful descent more than just chance, and you might not be entirely alone after all…

Source: The Game Website.

129813.name: Champions: Live Action
129813.description:
[From the back cover.]

Champions: Live Action brings the excitement of superheroic adventure to the world of LARPs! Using the popular Champions Universe setting from the award-winning tabletop RPG and the Champions Online MMO, Champions: Live Action gives you all the pulse-pounding adventure while allowing you to play away from the table or computer. The groundbreaking PCD system uses a simple stopwatch as a randomizer so the action never has to slow down!

This book includes:

The complete rules for playing the game- nothing else needed!
Dozens of sample characters, including the Champions themselves and several of their most fiendish adversaries!
An introduction to the Champions Universe, including Millennium City, the City of Tomorrow built on the ashes of Detroit!
Extensive advice for how to LARP in a world of superheroes and supervillains, even if you’ve never LARPed before! Costumes, props, locations, and how to recruit and manage players!




So bust out your uniform, strap on your utility belt, and get ready to smash some evil, because it’s time to play Champions: Live Action!

129814.name: Volk ans Gewehr
129814.description:
Objective: Eliminate or block all opponent meeples
- acting/moving by turns -
First each player is positioning troops (20) and obstacles (trees (17),houses & rivers (15)) upon own side; obstacles block movement.

Movement (transversal/horizontal/vertical) one step like Halma, but own and opposing meeples can be skipped; skipped enemies are removed.

Published during WW II

129815.name: Fable: The Journey
129815.description:
Set fifty years after the events of Fable III, the player controls a normal Dweller named Gabriel who has been separated from his tribe. Gabriel comes across Theresa, who has been wounded by a darkness called The Corruption. The Corruption is taking over Albion, and Gabriel must take her to the Tattered Spire to restore her power.

The game takes place throughout large portions of Albion. The events of Fable III are still felt during Fable: The Journey. According to developers, Fable: The Journey will read previous Fable III save files and change the game world accordingly. Details about loading these saves remains unclear.

Player decisions will also affect the character's horse who drives the player's carriage throughout the game. If you spur your horse forward quickly with a whip, the horse's health may deteriorate. Alternatively, if you treat your horse well, it may exhibit a healthy glow. According to information revealed at E3 2012, the horse may even learn specific voice commands used when you spur it forward. It has been confirmed that this entry in the franchise does not deal with the ancient archon bloodline featured in past entries.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fable: The Journey", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

129816.name: REALISM
129816.description:
Realism is a money-based board game which is easy to play at the basic level with a subtle form of competition where, unlike other money games, winners do not succeed at the expense of other players, so everyone can enjoy the game. A realistic game which makes players differentiate between needs and wants and encourages them to analyze their risk and limit their exposure.

The object of the game is to try to become a virtual millionaire by buying property, shares & other assets. The players have jobs, can invest, take out loans and buy insurance. During play there are personal and market events to cope with.

This game is particularly relevant in these difficult financial times, as it encourages individuals to think more deeply about the financial decisions they make.

The game is aimed at adults and the family and helps the players learn about investment and spot the difference between "good" debt and "bad" debt. While playing they can build up their income with good investments and try to avoid buying costly luxuries.

The winner is the player with the most net assets when play finishes.

129817.name: Fable: The Lost Chapters
129817.description:
The Lost Chapters features all the content found in the original Fable with new content such as new monsters, weapons, alignment based spells, items, armour, towns, buildings, and expressions, as well as the ability to give children objects.

The story received further augmentation with the addition of nine new areas and sixteen additional quests. Characters such as Briar Rose and Scythe who played minor roles in the original game have now been given more importance and are included in certain main and side quests. Other character-based augmentations include the antagonist, Jack of Blades' voice sounding deeper, harsher and more demonic and being able to uncover (and resolve) the murder mystery behind Lady Grey's sister.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fable (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

129818.name: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Save Tommy Game
129818.description:
Power Rangers, The evil Rita and Lord Zedd have imprisoned Tommy! It’s up to you to save him. Fight your way through the Evil Space Aliens and Putty Patrol warriors as your travel along the path of the Moon Palace to save Tommy and defeat Rita and Lord Zedd.

Players choose their favorite Mighty Morphin Power Ranger to play as. Each player's ranger has 5 health chips. If they lose battles against the Evil Space Aliens or Putty Patrol warriors, they'll lose one health chip. They'll need land on a Power Ranger space or give up a turn in order to regain health back.

Game play consists of rolling the die and moving your Power Ranger in any direction on the board within the level the players Power Ranger is on. There are four levels to Moon Palace Rangers need to advance through to make it to top to battle Rita and Lord Zedd to save Tommy.

Board spaces include; Power Ranger spaces (regain one health chip back), Putty Patrol warrior spaces (have battle a Putty; roll two dice, higher die wins battle), Evil Space Aliens spaces (they are blocking your Power Rangers path to next level, need acquire the Ready for Action chip in order fight them), and Ready for Action spaces (players need to get each of these within the level they are in, in order to fight the Evil Space Alien that is blocking them from advancing to next level) and blank spaces.

Players Power Rangers will need perform certain dice rolls to obtain a Ready for Action chip and when battling the Evil Space Aliens. Example; Roll either 1, 2 or 3. As your Power Ranger advances through the levels of the game board, they will become be challenging. Players need to obtain at least 4 Ready for Action chips in order to battle the last Evil Space Alien blocking them from reaching top level of the Moon Palace to battle Rita and Lord Zedd to save Tommy.

129819.name: Fable Heroes
129819.description:
Set in the Fable Universe, the player plays as one of 12 characters from across the 4 Fable Games and are presented in a Hero Doll Form which are a recognisable item from the series. In the game the player journeys through Albion and fights against familiar foes and new enemies to collect coins that are used to unlock new items and characters in Fable Heroes as well as Fable: The Journey, there are also boss fights in the game as well as smaller enemies which are fought in groups. Familiar enemies from the series include Chesty, Hobbes, Beetles and Hollow Men. There are also items in the levels, hidden within chests, that grant the player temporary abilities such as Slow Time, there are also items that give the player temporary disguises, like a Hobbe Costume, that hide the player from the relevant enemies so that they don't attack the player.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fable Heroes", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

129820.description:
Every year, thousands of salmon are compelled to leave the ocean and return to the river of their birth. This perilous journey can span hundreds of miles and is fraught with danger. Strong rapids, waterfalls, hungry bears, and eagles all await the salmon on their quest to spawn. Only the most fit will complete the salmon run!

Salmon Run is a fast-paced racing game in which you'll maneuver your salmon upriver, avoiding obstacles and jumping over waterfalls. Behold the immense power of the river's currents! Avoid ferocious bears! Beware of stealthy eagles, waiting to snatch victory from your hand! Most of all, pace yourself to avoid debilitating fatigue. Salmon Run features:


Deck-building: The path you choose upriver will determine which cards you may add to your swimming deck. Enhance your swimming ability by gaining powerful swim cards!
Player Interaction: Acquire cards to unleash hungry bears and eagles on your opponent's salmon! Unlock the power of the river's raging rapids and strong currents!
Fatigue: Overexertion leads to the build-up of fatigue which will slow you down!
Modular boards: Experience a new river each game! The river's difficulty and length can be customized to your liking!
129820.name: Salmon Run
boardgameexpansion: Salmon Run: The Fork/Cataract Falls Board
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 16:City of Iron/Blue Peg Patrick Hot Seat
Episode 42: The Episode of Brotherly LOVE
Exploring Games, Episode 10: Unpub Mini and More Reviews!
SpieLamaCast, die zweite (Folge 2)

129821.name: Almonaster
129821.description:
"Almonaster is a turn-based multi-player war game that is free for all players. The game is fully web-based and requires no downloads, Javascript, Java or ActiveX controls. If you are reading this page and your browser can post forms, then you can play."

Almonaster is a variant of the online game Stellar Crisis. Resources that may be useful for a better understanding of the culture and gameplay of both games include:

Source: The Game Website.

129822.description:
Snoopy Card Game "With Your Favorite Peanuts Characters" consists of character cards from Charles Schulz's Peanuts comic strips: Charlie Brown, Lucy, Linus, Woodstock and, of course, Snoopy; each character card has a different color background. Players are dealt four cards, which they then play in turn, one at a time, on the gameboard, a 5 x 5 grid. At different points in the game, players claim ownership of a row and a column and, when all spaces are filled, score for their color combinations.
Except for the title and artist (Schulz), this game has no connection to the Milton Bradley game of the same name from 1974.
129822.name: Snoopy Card Game

129823.name: 7th Dragon 2020
129823.description:
It features polygon graphics and takes place in the near-future, with classes such as Hacker and Psychic added to the roster.

Source: Wikipedia, "7th Dragon", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

129824.name: Minotaur (Issue 8 - Sep 2010)
rpgissuearticle: A Twist in the Maze: No Mean Feat!
Griffin Archives: Fun with the Four Elements
Maze Master’s Lore: Gods of the East
Muse’s Corner: The New Clash of the Titans
Mythic Bestiary: Born of the Elements
Mythika Gazetteer: The Land of the Sun
129824.description: This 60+ page issue includes a complete detailed gazetteer on the Land of the Sun, two complete adventures, two optional classes (Pankratiasts & Sacred Healers), optional rules on unarmed combat, medical mythic items, new tricks for Elementalists, a variant system for feats of strength, new creatures etc.

129825.name: Minotaur (Issue 9 - Spring 2011)
rpgissuearticle: A Twist in the Maze: Rules of Flying
Bonus Feature: Where the Wild Things Are
Griffin Archives: Places to Plunder, Monsters to Slay!
Maze Master’s Lore: Runes of Midgard
Mythika Gazetteer: Centaurs of the Sicanian Plains
Pandora’s Box: Treasures of the Vikings
129825.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 70+ page issue includes a gazetteer on the Centaurs of Sicania, an epic adventure set in a hitherto unknown part of Mythika, new abilities for creatures, optional rules for flying creatures and plenty of other wondrous M&M stuff - including a special Vikings & Valkyries section with a complete adventure, mythic items and more!

129826.name: Minotaur (Issue 10 - Mar 2012)
rpgissuearticle: A Twist in the Maze: Marksmen & Missiles
Adventure: The Spear of Tamro (1/3) - The Call of the Wild
Bonus Mythic Bestiary: Beneath the Waves
Bonus Mythic Gazetteer: The Middle Sea
Campaign Plot: The Quest for Prince Argan
Maze Master’s Lore: The Power of Names
129826.description:
From publisher blurb:

Giant-sized (100+ pages!) issue with a mega-section on Charybdis, the Dark Continent of Mythika, including a complete gazetteer, Charybdian adventurers, creatures, magic and mythic items and an epic adventure; also includes a bonus dossier on the Middle Sea, islands & colonies and some new marine creatures!

129827.name: Guin Saga
129827.description:
Two fantasy wargames in one box, based on Japanese heroic fantasy novel Guin saga. These games is covering the war between Parros and Mongauli.

Both games use standard hex and counter mechanism, so repeat of movement and combat.

Nospherus is small size operational level wargame based on story from book 1 to 5. This game covering for pursuit battles in Nospherus. Contains special rules for leaders, wasteland environment and Mongauli's colored legions. Winner determined by capture or escape of crown prince and princess of Parros.

"Parros" is medium size strategic level wargame based on story of book 1 to 16. This game covering entire war between Parros and Mongauli. Contains special rules for recruit, diplomacy, rebellion, capture and escape. Winner determined by collapse of either nation.

129828.name: X-Project
129828.description:
User Summary

An X-com clone from Mobileap, an russian mobile games producer.

The Producer was Vladimir Kuznetsov

The Gameplay is turn based like in the original X-com but without the planefights or the basebuilding. It is essential an base defending game or attacking game like Jagged Alliance.

The Protagonist find himself in an Laboratory that is attacked by Mutants, Robots and mad Scientists.
At first the Protagonist is alone, but it is possible to gather other survivors at a later part of the game.
It is the mission of the protagonist to destroy the alien creatures that essentially destroyed Project X.

129829.name: French Rails
129829.description: French Rails is a Print and Play map in the crayon rails series of games. Players receive demand cards where cities want different goods. These goods and cities are scattered across the map, and the players must construct track by drawing on the board to connect the cities with the goods they demand. Each demand card has three different deliveries on it, and players much decide which demands work best together so they can optimize both movement and track building. Money is very tight at the beginning of the game as the payouts do not completely cover the cost of track, so players must slowly build a network that they can use repeatedly to generate enough cash to win the game.

129830.name: Tableau Infractus (Issue 9, Fall 2011)
129830.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

129831.name: Warhammer: Space Hulk
129831.description:
User Summary

Space Hulk is a depiction for Mobilephones of the Warhammer 40,000 board game.
It is played top down, and is turn based. It does not include any of the expansions of the original boardgame. Sadly there is also no Level Editor

The Features are :

You can play as either the Terminator Marines or the Genestealers, but nothing else.
Turn based strategic/tactical gameplay (as in the original board game)

The turn based modes offers only a multi-mission campaign for either Genestealers or Marines.

129832.name: Tableau Infractus (Issue 10, Fall 2011)
129832.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

129833.name: Tableau Infractus (Issue 11, Winter 2011)
129833.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

129834.name: Tableau Infractus (Issue 12, Winter 2012)
129834.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

129835.name: Our Last Best Hope
129835.description:
As indicated on the back of the book:

This is the primary rulebook for Our Last Best Hope, a single session tabletop roleplaying game for three 3-5 players that takes about 2-3 hours to play. Our Last Best Hope is a game about a crew of people on a mission to save Humanity from a terrible Crisis. During the game, participants will play through a classic disaster movie, like Sunshine, Deep Impact, The Core, or Armageddon, where their characters are the stars. Each game is unique, comprising a new Crisis with a new set of characters and a new plan to save the Earth.

Example story lines from a session of Our Last Best Hope include:

...launching into space to stop a meteor from destroying all life on Earth.
...drilling to the center of the Earth to restart its molten core.
...navigating zombie filled cities to stop a nuclear holocaust.

Regardless of the Crisis, the characters played by the participants represent the last best hope for averting disaster.

Our Last Best Hope does not require a GM, nor is there any preptime required before the game starts. The game has is inspired by roleplaying classics like Fiasco and Polaris.
rpgpodcastepisode: Actual Play: Our Last Best Hope, Part I
Actual Play: Our Last Best Hope, Part II
AP – Our Last Best Hope – “The Crystal Hunters”

129836.description:
This game is the 1st expansion to Dominion Nitroplus Card Masters.
It features 152 cards with characters from Phantom PHANTOM OF INFERNO, "Hello, world.", Demonbane, Jingai Makyo, Hanachirasu, Gekko no Carnevale, Zoku Satsuriku no Jango (TRE DONNE CRUDELI) -Jigoku no Shoukinkubi-, CHAOS;HEAD, Sumaga, STEINS;GATE, Full Metal Daemon Muramasa, AXANAEL, Guilty Crown Lost Christmas, etc.
This expansions also adds coins to the gameplay with a design featuring Kyubey from Puella Magi Madoka Magica.
129836.name: Nitroplus Card Masters Plus

129837.name: Words of Life
boardgameversion: Life Eternal Evangelism Baptist Bible College Special Edition
129837.description:
This is an "action Bible game" with a Christian trivia theme.

The educational design features basic doctrine and trivia in a question and answer format. Players use a spinner to move along a rainbow-shaped pathway. A correct response allows the player to advance to the a square matching the color shown on the dial.

Grace cards allow a player to take a bonus move. Sin cards force a player to lose a turn. These cards are mixed into the trivia deck. The first player to land on the "Abundant Life" space is declared the winner.

Includes the board with a spinner, the cards, and tokens.

129839.name: Iron Assault
129839.description:
User Summary

A giant mech game where you join the resistance to fight the evil corporations that have taken over the world.

129840.description:
UNRELEASED GAME



Note that all details for this game are preliminary.





NEW EXPANSION RULES: PORTKEY OF CHAOS

The Basic Strike Dice Game consists of 8 Basic Triangle Cards which carry the Attributes of the Creatures you will meet in the Expansion. These Attributes are also part of the Triangle Bases of the Arena (Gameboard). Next, you will find 32 Pyramid Dice of different color, 8 per player. In the same basic pack you will find and the Strike Dice Expansion: Portkey of Chaos consisting of the 9 Creatures plus the New Rules.


THE GAME

The game here consists of 3 Phases: In each Phase you draw in order 3 Creature Cards. Place the cards on the triangle bases of the board according to which attribute they represent. The creatures carry 2 different numbers: The left number indicates the strength and the right number the Bonus you receive when you kill a Creature. To destroy a Creature you must roll a number with your Pawndie higher from the one which represents his Strength and place it on the opposite Tribase where this Creature is located. When you do that, you draw as many Tricards as the Bonus number this Creature caries on his right side. You keep these cards and you may use them as you wish. Note: The Rules of the Basic Game Apply here too, the only difference is that the Creatures add new elements in the game. You also keep and the Creature you killed since it counts as part of the collected cards. The player with the most cards in the end of 3rd round is the winner.
129840.name: Strike Dice & The Portkey of Chaos

129841.name: Pass out
129841.description:
Object of the Game: To be the player with the most markers on the board at the end of the game.

Game Play: Two (2) players need a pair of dice and fifteen (15) markers each. Player with the dark markers throws the dice first. The numbers as shown on the dice (either individual numbers or combination of the two dice) are then covered on the board. When all twenty-one (21) spaces on the board are covered, the game is over.

The game board contains 21 squares each containing a picture of 2 dice rolls (i.e. one square has a picture of 2 smaller squares, one with three (3) dots, the other with two (2), representing a possible roll) each square contains a different possible roll.

129842.name: The Mask of Death
129842.description:
From the minds of Matt Vancil, creator of The Gamers and the hit web series JourneyQuest and newcomer Kevin Mickelson comes the long-anticipated return to Fartherall seen in the film The Gamers: Dorkness Rising. The Mask of Death takes playres through the adventure featured in the film along with new monsters, enemies and an entirely new dungeon! Play as the party from the movie - Brother Silence, Daphne, Sir Osric, Luster (either one) and the virtually immortal bard, Flynn the Fine - or create an all-new team of heroes!

Save the Kingdom! Seduce the celibate! Spread the buttery justice of Therin!

Onward...To waffles!

(Source: Back of book)

129843.name: The Indigo Galleon
129843.description:
from the introduction

An introductory adventure for first level characters, for use with the Dungeon World RPG.

129844.name: Legend Cheat Sheet
129844.description:
from product description

4 Page Landscape GM screen / Cheat Sheet for Mongoose Legend.

129845.name: Der Apfelbaum: Ein neues Rechenspiel
129845.description:
Objective: flip balls into holes of different values in the box base & sum up values
- acting by turns -
each player shoots 6 balls summing up gained values;
compared with Flying Hats
balls instead of cones are used - you can't hit the same hole; players are challenged summing up.

129846.name: Welt-Reise-Spiel
129846.description:
objective: journey around the world - be the first ending your round trip in Berlin
- acting by turns -
each player draws 4 (hidden) travel cards; in order to move forward you must play a matching (colour/symbol) card regarding next space; you even may step further if you play another matching one; if you possess a card with a plane (image) you even move three spaces ahead (if it matches).
After end of your turn fill up to 4 cards;
remarks: published end 1950's/early 60's

129847.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 1 - Jun 1975)
rpgissuearticle: Lidenrrock’s Log – Dice as Random Number Generators
Lidenrrock’s Log – Some Proposed Parameters for Firearms
Proposal for Character Type of Singer or Bard
Thoughts on Keeping Magic-Users Within Bounds
129847.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #1
June 1975

Cover art by Jack Harness.

129848.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 2 - Jul 1975)
rpgissuearticle: Proposal for Character Type of Singer or Bard - Part Two
The Normal: A New Character Type
129848.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #2
July 1975

Cover art by Jack Harness.

129849.name: Blade Thrust Tactics
129849.description:
A Jagged Alliance Clone

Blade Thrust Tactics takes place in a fictional world called Core of which the Idea Empire had invaded the whole world several years ago creating a global autocratic police state empire the people hate. So the Alliance has been formed to fight the giant empire. As the Alliance lacks resources, guerilla war has been adopted of which several small squads has been dispatched to attack several sectors in town occupied by soldiers who works for the Empire. You are in charge of special squad which comprises of talented special operatives but to use their services, you have to pay. The game has 2 gameplay layers on it. On the surface is a challenging real time tactical combat game of which you need to employ your tactical skills to get rid the enemy. Another gameplay layer is extensive resource management game of which you need to optimize the usage of little resource you have to achieve your objectives.

Source: The Game Website.

129850.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 3 - Aug 1975)
rpgissuearticle: The Ignorable Mockturtle or I'm Just a Little D&D Zine, Short and Stout
129850.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue #3
August 1975

Cover art by Jack Harness.
